WDiYuGOHSmGuuSymxFDcxA.text: I'm kinda bummed. I had such high expectations for this restaurant. Based off of the high stars and atmosphere, I thought I found a new sushi place. I moved from southwest to very central. This was about a 30-45 minute drive which isn't too crazy if the food were really good. Yelp said it was a 15-28 minute wait when we looked on our way. So, we got there and the hostess told us it's more like 30-45 minutes. So, since I drove that far and still had high expectations (now from a long wait too), I waited in the car to get texted. After about 30 minutes, I decided to sit inside because one person in my 3 people party was disabled so I didn't want to lose our place from how long it takes us to walk in. When we got in, she said about another 15 minutes. About 15 minutes passed, and we were told that there were only 2 people before us. The hostess called a name and my brother said "I think she's outside." the waitress brushed it off and waited a couple minutes before calling the next name. Then after about 5 more minutes we asked how much longer because she had called the two names and she said that we were next. Then, the girl who she called came in and asked how long because she was waiting for a while. The hostess said she texted her and the girl showed her that she never received any texts. After the hostess walked around and lowkey ignored the girl sitting in the waiting room, she sat another group of people and then sat us. 55 minutes of waiting. The sushi was really fast and tasted good. But honestly, the rest of the service sucked. I had to remind them twice about kitchen orders I put in, we asked for more water and they forgot about those too, we were given dishes that had water and dried on crumbs on them, we were kinda disappointed with everything aside from the actual sushi chefs, they were quick and made everything pretty good. Only complaint was the garlic tuna was really dry but we just asked for more sauce on it. So, service was about a C- and I don't plan on coming here again. We ended up taking 3 hours to have dinner here.

ZwQSCnXY44lofADqxU83VQ.text: So far, Everytime I have been to Umami has been a good experience. I enjoy their AYCE menu. Their sashimi is very good. CZnQcLJH6GFTQoU4SVCl5Q.text: we went here with a huge group of 26. we were well accommodated by staff. food was also great and value for money is just wow compared to other japanese restos. it was a very pleasant experience even with 10 kids!

qRhQ4jLRsS02DRdFEqTw2w.text: Fabulous addition to the neighborhood! I love having awesome places near by and this place is not one to be overlooked. I came here on a Monday night, surprisingly no one was there! Even better, more space for me!  I really like the decor, dark and sexy. It's really dim with open space and a couple of booths. May be because we were the only ones there but the it felt really spacious.  Food was fantastic! We tried a couple of rolls and washed it down with blueberry sake. Fish tasted really fresh.  Tried: Anna Roll, Red Bull Roll, Rock N Roll. My absolute favorite was the Rock N Roll, if you like raw fish and cucumber - this roll is for you. I love rice-less rolls and I LOVE raw fish so this was BOMB for me. It comes with a sauce on the side.  The Red Bull roll was really good as well, it comes with jalapeno slices on top which is a "no thank you for me" but it was yummy without it. Escolar on top and soft shell crab and cucumber inside wrapped truly fresh rice. My partner in crime for the day got the Anna roll to honor herself :) It was pretty good as well. She also had Toro sushi, which I did not try but she really enjoyed.  There are a few things on the menu that I look forward to coming back and trying. I actually attempted to order lobster ramen to-go the other day and it was going to be a 45 min wait. Ugh! I was next door and did not plan to wait around for 45 min but will definitely come back for it in the near tomorrow.

9Gr66cDcaHW_Rz-26b4yLA.text: We have been waiting for a great sushi experience in the north part of vegas. We found it in Umami. To my surprise, they are linked to Sakana and Neko, which were both good choices for ayce sushi. We did go during the ending of their lunch menu and it was't crowded at all. I am sure the foot traffic picks up during dinner as well. We got a booth and it was very spacious and comfortable.  The one major standout here was the service. Excellent customer service sets Umami far apart from establishments like Goemon who have gone downhill due to their lack of service. Our waters were filled often, orders were taken and brought to us in a timely manner, our table and plates were cleaned so often that i felt bad for making them have to stop by our table so often.  The fish was fresh on every different nigiri order as well as their rolls and appetizers. Our server even brought my 5 year old a chopstick holder so she could use her chopsticks instead of a fork.   I can't say enough great things about this place and i guarantee it will be our go to AYCE sushi from now on.

L2XA3JZihVpekj4HdgiCHg.text: AYCE sushi spots tend to have a bad reputation because most of them have limited choices and way too much RICE on every roll! Not this place. The sushi is so incredibly fresh and the options are endless. My advice is to take advantage of the AYCE deal. You just can't beat it! I'm currently pregnant and missing my typical sushi orders, but they have a lot of yummy cooked rolls and other great menu options. That way, my husband doesn't have to go sushi-free for 9 months :)

O5vAB-VRwDsxoo59cEB0ag.text: We went on a Monday night, and there weren't very many people in the restaurant. However, there were only 3 people working the floor total-- 2 bussers and one person taking orders. For this reason, service was SloOOOOoOoow. I kept trying to get workers' attention, and they just kept whizzing by me, even after giving me eye contact. We were hangry to say the least, so I had to take a star off for service. There were maybe 4 other parties at the restaurant at this point.  However, the sushi was worth the wait. It was delicious, fresh, and reasonably priced. I ordered a Spicy Tuna, Tamago, and an Alaskan Roll. The size of the rolls are really generous, and I was stuffed by the end! My husband ordered the dinner special-- $13.99 for meat of choice, tempura, california roll, salad, soup, and gyoza. SO much food and a great deal. He couldn't even finish it all!  Overall, I'd definitely return and try it again. I noticed a Help Wanted sign in the window, so hopefully service improves as they get more staff.

tLeJ2tVQ-ndu8-iVKD3uSA.text: I absolutely love this place. Their sushi is delicious and fresh...all you can eat is exceptionally priced and includes everything, even dessert! If you do the ayce, I definitely recommend the yuzu yellowtail and 300 albacore. I've tried most things on the menu and have yet to be disappointed. Service is always great, there's never a long wait, and it's great for families, dates, or by yourself! If you go solo sit at the sushi bar and the chef will recommend things for you to try based on your preferences. If you haven't gone here you're missing out!

UpMrSgS34dV0wWSg-H3rOQ.text: They have wonderful sushi that tastes amazing. But every time I have come to eat here the service has been terrible. Once they forgot one of my friends orders and never brought their food. Second time the server had attitude and was not welcoming. Overall the food is good but not the best of service for the price.

pTHxfWwNyTsNug6ARfeVZA.text: I'm so happy there's a decent sushi/ramen place in Centennial Hills. Umami is just up the street from our house, which is AWESOME! My husband and I love this place! We came here on a Thursday night. When you first walk in, you'll notice the dark, sheek decor. The lighting was dim for dinner time. We were greeted by a waitress who seated us right away! You can choose to sit at a table in the dining room or at the bar to watch the sushi chef's make delicious creations.   FOOD   If I could rate this place based only on the food, I would give it 5-stars. Every dish was delicious! We ordered:   1. Wasabi Octopus: Raw octopus w/ a wasabi sauce on top. It'll clear your nostrils as you chew on the tender octopus.   2. Toro Nigiri Special: MELT IN YOUR MOUTH DELICIOUS! Get it. It's a special that you'll have to ask your server about.   3. Applejack Nigiri Special: I've never tried the applejack fish before (I also hope to God I heard the lady right when she recommended it). The nigiri came with a sort of ponzu sauce w/ jalapeno's on top. I loved this dish!   4. Tiger Roll: The rolls at Umami are well-balanced that is not rice heavy. It's a simple tiger roll that tasted good since the fish is clearly fresh and the technique used held the entire roll together w/o breaking.   5. Lobster Ramen: The highlight of our meal was the lobster ramen. However, it is spicy!!! This bowl is huge. It's perfect to share. The ramen came w/ a generous serving of noodles, soup, a huge lobster tail, mussels and mushrooms. I recommend ordering this, especially for those who love their Ramen extra spicy. The ramen noodles I've had better elsewhere, but it's still good.   6. Strawberry Champagne Cake: The cake is light, fluffy and semi-sweet. Get this as a dessert to end your meal on a sweet note.   PRICE   Our meal w/ tip was $100 for two people. Umami does not offer an AYCE (All You Can Eat) option. Everything is a la carte. The quality of the food and the generous portion of the Lobster Ramen made it worth the price. I recommend coming here for a special occasion since it is a lot pricier than other sushi restaurants.   SERVICE   The service is the primary reason why I knocked this review down from a 5-star to a 4-star. The service started off great, but they didn't staff properly so when it became busy our waitress forgot about us. We sat there waiting for our check for a good 15 mins before our waitress noticed we didn't get our check yet. Sadly, this is a common issue with new restaurants that cut costs by understaffing. I think as they become more popular it shouldn't be as big of an issue and they'll have a higher budget to staff properly.   Overall, my husband and I loved the food at Umami. The service could be improved. If you come here, be prepared to spend money since it is higher end. The quality of the food, the taste and preparation makes it worth it!   Happy Dining,  J Tran

_Ca92zsJIEliIl89qh24dw.text: Living in NW Las Vegas means when you're hungry taste buds are saying Udon! Ramen  Bento  or sushi  means a 13 mile trip into the Decatur--Jones--Spring Mountain Asian Food Triangle  .... By chance I wanted to visit the T-Mobile store located at Durango and the 215 exit.....when I pulled into a parking slot, I noticed that the store almost in front of me had a big sign reading UMAMI (and that means tasty good in Japanese)...they had a sidewalk billboard with the words " All You Can Eat Sushi  "    ...We went in looked at the menu and it included Bento, Ramen, Udon, Teriyaki, & grilled  fish. Wow    ....we ordered one spicy  tuna and one California Roll...and both tasted freshly made using good sushi  rice. My wife ordered Tempura Udon and i ordered Tonkotsu Ramen-----the udon tasted delicious and my ramen was original and unique to this establishment ..and it was  tasty... will come back to this place when we don't want to drive into town for  Japanese food

xmiaWyoaay6B0EO7xGpk1A.text: Went here last weekend after looking at reviews. This place is nice and clean inside. Number 1 thing is they take your order, wait to let you order again and sushi rolls are huge to fill you up quickly. Stack em deep, fill em cheap and get them out. Service was ok,  I had to keep staring at my waiter walking around to order more.  My reason for two stars is due to the food.  Some things are really good but also really easy to make.  Like fried calamari or shrimp tempura is easy and really good. But my gripe is with some food like the bulgogi because it came with ALOT of cabbage in bottom.  You have to eat everything or be charged. The meat was great but alot of unnecessary cabbage. So after apps and WAITING to order again I get into the sushi rolls. These rolls here are freaking huge. Like non traditional size and can't pick up effectively with chops sticks without breaking the roll size. Rolls were good. Toward the end I tried special menu. A mini bowl of curry ramen and a HALF sushi roll. Curry ramen was worse than a pack of ramen from grocery store and no real curry taste. The "half" roll was literally the size of a baseball all the way through and I had to ask for a knife to cut it in half. I ordered some other things as well and so did my wife and they did not bring them. I've eaten at 20 star ayce sushi places and this just isnt it. Won't be back but glad I know to avoid at all cost. Sakana or yamada sushi on Maryland Pkwy are better, don't waste your money because it's worth the drive.

9d33WJEBqwPiCPo0D60RGw.text: This place is crazy over rated. Let's start with the not horrible parts:  1. The Sushi was not bad I would give it a 4 out of 5 2. After making us wait a ridiculous amount of time they apologized (there was a mix up) and gave us a small discount but it wasn't enough to make up for everything else.  The bad:  1. We ordered sodas and they brought us cans of sodas. I'm actually fine with the cans, whatever if you can't afford a soda machine. The problem is that you didn't tell me ahead of time that I was paying for a drink that I wouldn't get free refills on. I shouldn't get this type of surprise. 2. The chicken in the dishes was not very good quality, this nice of a place should not have Panda Express level chicken. 3. They should have figured out way earlier that there was a problem with our order. The two people who were eating sushi had already started eating a second round before they even started cooking the other food. Fail.

1oWEs7S6tbnATon7i9PTjw.text: Worth the drive out this way from the strip. After seeing the Lobster in Spicy Miso Noodle Soup fr other yelpers, we decided to end our Vegas trip by going to Umami. We arrived for lunch and was welcomed and seated by Caleb. He informed us that the lobster noodle soup was a dinner item and was not avail during lunch...what???!?, so Caleb checked with the kitchen and yay!, they made it happen...we got to have it and it was yummy. The lobster was perfectly cooked ($17). Sashimi and sushi is fresh! Decor and ambience is very nice. The tuna is the same quality you would get at Nobu. Seriously, Nobu has nothing on this place, Umami is excellent!!! Beef bowl and eel with rice for the kids was delicious. Even the garlic edemame was so good.   Great sushi chefs. Excellent service by Caleb. Other servers were friendly as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sashimi &amp; Sushi  $16...so fresh and delicious
Photo of Umami - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster In Spicy Miso Soup....lobster was perfect..very good! $17

4YfqD0RC-SAd3Uwt4L9faw.text: A great meal of sushi and great typical Japanese style dinner combos in NLV. Went here tonight for the first time and having never been here previously when it was a different owner. Offers a 10% military discount too.   The atmosphere was trendy and spare, with paintings on the walls and in the bathrooms and lots of wood and black, and funnily enough a good amount of upbeat K Pop style music and christmas songs. Great spot for large or small parties of adults for happy hour! Try the pear sake!  Impressed with the level of professionalism given by the new management/owner, who came to my table to discuss when I politely explained that the spicy miso ramen dish I'd ordered was not to my taste.   He wanted to ask why out of curiosity. I've had it before in other places many times before moving to Vegas and I had nothing to hide since I barely ate any of it. Sometimes the taste just isn't what you expect! And he understood but was concerned.   I felt very well taken care of, he even offered to comp my next ramen, which I said was totally unnecessary. I enjoy giving my business to a good place if they treat me well, once I find what I love to eat, and Umami has MANY options.   The new management has similar offerings throughout Vegas in four other restaurants that offer AYCE options, which includes standard nigiri and baked/fried/hand rolls. Crab, lobster, tuna, avocado, cream cheese, ponzu, yum yum and SOS sauce seems to be the go-to on many rolls. I can't hate on it because it works.   I've been frequenting one of the other "partner" restaurants, Sakana, a lot recently and having LOVED their options but hated the far drive, finding this place made me happy. The menus are similar and prices, but small differences in presentation and style.   Our waiter, a young Asian man took a while to greet and seat us but when we finally sat five mins after entering what looked to be a nearly empty restaurant we saw that there were only two servers on the floor and a party of 12 on the far side, hidden from the front, and a few others. Also, the entire time our server was not only serving them but also preparing various to-go boxes. Poor guy probably prepped like 5-6 just in the time we were there, maybe for phone orders. He was as attentive as he could be, responding quickly to us and getting help from the other server and food runner.   The rolls we ordered were great, dinner combo worthwhile though I wasn't a fan of the very acidic vinaigrette on the salad that came with the combo. I like mine genuine Japanese style with sesame oil. I ordered one to go as well. Overall, would come back as soon as I can!

wM7eKRW7vV86XFSlZRMTQw.text: First timers here!!! We were looking for a great AYCE sushi place on this side of town, and we chose the BEST place!!! Located off 215/Durango their staff is super nice and attentive and FOOD is sushi grade!!!!! Check them out!!!!!!  Thanks Vanessa for your customer service!!

nfWSYezNTeDNEkWc569Adg.text: Completely blew my expectations! I drove 45 mins from Henderson to try this place and it was worth the drive!  ATMOSPHERE: The decor of this place was actually really nice. They have large TVs which would be fun on game nights. The waiter was a little quiet, but she was really nice. I highly recommend sitting at the sushi bar because the sushi chef were very interactive and nice. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED THIS RESTAURANT!  FOOD: The pricing of the food was absolutely perfect for this sushi restaurant, I hope that never changes. They offer different combos that are delicious, filling, and easy on your wallet. The Unagi Don is a large bowl of rice with fresh water eel and eel sauce, it comes with miso soup and a choice of cucumber salad or green salad. The Unagi Don was absolutely delicious, my favorite restaurant that makes it in Vegas. Their Sushi & Sashimi Combo comes with chef selected nigiri and sashimi, in addition you get to choose between a California Roll, Spicy Tuna9 Roll, Salmon and Avocado Roll, or Vegetable Roll. You can also order sushi individually here. The Ami Ebi (Sweet Shrimp) Nigiri is not only beautiful, but made to perfection. They have a smaller specialty rolls menu, but they all look amazing.  DESSERT: They have a more unique dessert menu compared to other restaurants. For cakes, they have a delicious Champagne Cake or a Cheesecake. I was surprised that they have Macarons here in various flavors such as chocolate, passion fruit, and pistachio. As a Japanese restaurant, it's only fitting that they have Mochi Ice Cream in most flavors. Additionally, they have Affogato which is vanilla ice cream with a shot of espresso.  DRINK: They have a full sake menu. Their hot tea comes in a cute teapot. They have the basic fountain drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Unagi Don, sooooo good!
Photo of Umami - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soup and salad with the Unagi Don
Photo of Umami - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice sushi chef

u6A9qw7uB-q2I6CgK8lcdA.text: Went for lunch.  It's deceiving because the windows are darkened.  We almost thought it was closed, but they open at 11 am.  Walking inside was a treat.  The dark interior made it relaxing.  Great acoustic music on in the background.  Sat at the sushi bar.  Hubby ordered the #5 which he loved.  I had the marinated pork ribs with rice.  Also had the house salad & Their ginger dressing was fantastic.  Tasted very fresh.    Service was impeccable.  The sushi bartender, Jun, was very knowledgeable & super friendly.  Very welcoming person.    We will be back to try the ramen!!!

KJtHyYhjIRBnD5vu2vGdnQ.text: I took my family to Umami for dinner after we watched a movie.  Thing I liked: -Spicy Miso Ramen: no doubt it was my favorite dish. It was more a Korean style ramen rather than Japanese one but nonetheless it was good. I enjoyed the soup base, the spicy level was perfect for me; it had heat but not burning. The flavor reminded me of my favorite Korean instant noodle, Nongshim Shin Ramyun. It had plenty vegetable and the slices of pork was tasty.  Things were just okay: -Sushi: we ordered shrimp, Unagi, tuna roll. The sushi rice was a little bland; could use a little more seasoning in the rice, I would like a little more vinegar taste in the rice. Unagi was different than the ones from other restaurants, didn't have sauce on it but actually not bad.  -Teriyaki beef combo: it was a big bento box. It came with miso soup, fried dumplings, salad, California roll, rice, tempura shrimp and veggies, and the beef. The beef was average, the dumplings probably were from manufacturer. It was okay but they gave us a lot of food. -Tonkotsu ramen: the soup base was a little bland but the noodle was fine and firm. I liked the fried tofu that was in the bowl and plenty of veggies.  -Service: it wasn't bad and busboy was working hard, refilling water and cleaning out the table. One complaint that after dinner we realized that the server only brought us one miso soup. We ordered two combos so we should have two.   Things I didn't like: -Fried pork cutlet combo: Basically the same as the beef teriyaki combo except the protein. The pork was really dry and tough. They over cooked quite a bit. - KFC(Korean fried chicken): the dish was greasy and chicken pieces weren't crispy actually a little soggy. And I didn't like the sauce in it. Everyone tried a piece and no one went back for more, we didn't finish the chicken.  Overall I still don't have a go to sushi place around my neighborhood but whenever I want a nice bowl of noodle soup I'll be back at Umami.

kZQYwz4TuCwJxd2kmTf2aw.text: So sad to be writing this but the quality of this place has gone way down. I ate there yesterday they were slightly busy I never received 4 rolls that I ordered also waiting over 20 minutes for a simple roll my water cup was empty for more then half the time i we were there. 7s9Z87HxvETwCZyEqrYPFA.text: First time trying out this place with my friends yesterday it was fantastic. It seems like it was really busy full house and I saw people waiting outside. We were on the waitlist and got seated right away. Hannah was our server (pretty) and got started right away since she told us that food is going to be delayed due to everyone got sat down and everybody ordering bunch in the beginning. Most of appetizers and sushi (salmon belly) tasted Wonderful!! But we had to wait for rolls which I understand that it was really busy night. Hannah always comes back with such a great smile and guiding us that what we should try and the Manager Tyler was on top of everything that everytime when I was about to ask something he brings it out right away and tries to talk to us all the time and suggesting what we should try and even I heard him talking to other tables right next to me that he was making sure everything was okay and checking it up all the customers with professionalism.  I would definitely comeback for sure and thank you all the sushi chef for the great food.

EY-a_vRwwaGK7l-8lmtkJw.text: The sushi is awesome. It's AYCE (all you can eat). The fish are very fresh. If you go with a big group of friends (maybe 6-8 people) you can all share the food and maybe even get through the whole meal. It's a fun adventure ordering all the items on the menu.   They have a lot of pricy items on the menu. Those items are limited to one order per person. I definitely recommend those items. The unagi nigri, soft shell crabs, raw oysters, and poke are great seafood option to order.   Lunch is about $20 per person AYCE. Dinner is around $25 (but most likely closer to $30ish after tax and tip). Even though it's seems pricey, it's definitely worth the price since sushi in general is expensive. Here you can eat all the fresh seafood. More bang for your buck here.

-zK6ZJ-1CYUxzmMKLJRSkg.text: Was driving all around trying to finish up my things to do and the last stop was in the Centennial area. Was already hungry and felt like eating rice. Was having white rice withdrawals after being in Utah for 5 days. So sushi was it, all comes with rice.   Yelp had Umami at the beginning of the list and was the closest to where I was at. The ratings go from one end to the other so I wanted to decide for myself.   Got there and when I walked in, was immediately greeted by the staff. Love it.   Was seated and there were about eight other groups already there. Was a late lunch at about 2:30pm.   I went with the AYCE option and the menu was loaded on both sides. Ordered a bunch of stuff from rolls to grilled items. Everything smelled and tasted fresh. Some would say the fish was previously frozen but I say so what. The prices didn't reflect the high prices of fresh seafood so all is good.   The best part is the person making my sushi didn't try to load me up with a lot of rice. The fish pieces were large and in charge. Only thing missing was a dab of wasabi between the fish and rice. I can see where some people might not like that so this was no big deal.   The best part was at the end where I ordered the tempura ice cream. The way they do it here is the best. The coating was light and crispy. The ice cream was still relatively intact after being deep fried, sliced open and filled with whipped cream and topped with a cherry.   I would definitely go back again when in the area. The service was excellent and friendly.

wd9T73NwBiUNLKBBdTRfwA.text: All you can eat is just that   Probably too much...lol Service is very good.  Occasionally they get behind, but they bounce right back.

DikiftZLAas7gvQvJI53hg.text: This sushi restaurant has a great quality fish. The food is not overfilled with rice like other places in the city. I have been to many AYCE sushi restaurants in Las Vegas and without a doubt this is one of the best. The only downside is the restaurant is on the smaller side so if you go on the weekend, expect to wait for a bit. Other than that, service and food was fantastic. Can't wait to come back here!

nxeIKAfGnsOvzfNcFGlFUA.text: UPDATE: It's been a few months since I last ate here and the quality of this place has gone down. I'm only giving it 3 Stars because of our server Lindsay. She was very sweet and friendly. But as far as the food, it WAS NOT the same as before. First, our cups were cheap-lookin paper cups. I noticed that the regular hard plastic cups they had before was only used for soft drinks. As for the nigiri sushi, they put way too much rice. Before, the rice was very minimal and we loved it because that meant we could eat way more. The tempura (shrimp and rolls) was not fresh. It tasted like it was an extra batch and was left sitting out until an order came through. Some of our favorite sushi rolls were made completely different. The Chanel roll didn't have as much flavor. The Stuft Tomatoes was way too spicy with the new sauce they drenched the rolls in. The Yuzu Yellowtail had bigger pieces of jalapeno which overpowered the other flavors. The edamame wasn't even salted. And towards the end of the night we had to ask for water 3 times til we were given some. This was our go-to place for sushi. I really wana give this place another try on the off-chance that it might've been just one of those nights. I'm really rooting and hoping for this because this time was a disappointment.

u-dJBH1SQEO8fScv7oVcMw.text: Came in for an early dinner, first time here, usually a little leery of the AYCE sushi, however, this place is top notch in all respects, wait staff was super helpful and knowledgeable about the menu, made some great suggestions for us!  We had an excellent meal with excellent service and food quality was A+ in all respects, portions were good sized and they don't overload you with rice.  Most pleased with our choice for dinner tonight!  I do recommend this restaurant!

BdyWwl9MAXNofeJIh7_moA.text: This place is amazing! 100% the new go-to sushi spot for me.   This was mine and my girlfriend's first time here. In a way, I'm disappointed in myself because we live very close and we have neglected Umami for another sushi spot down the road.   Service: 5/5. Insanely fast, attentive, and nice. This was the fastest service I've experienced and it made the experience much more pleasant.   Food: 5/5. We both did the all you can eat, which is the way to go. The sushi was likely the best sushi I have had and everything was fresh.   -- Started off with Egg Rolls. Not much to say about these other than that they were solid. To be honest, I'm not sure if there is such thing as a bad egg roll  -- I ordered the "Red Dragon Roll" and the "Dancing Eel Roll." Both were amazing. I ended up ordering another Dancing Eel Roll.   -- My girlfriend ordered the "Snow in Vegas Roll" and the "Dragon Roll." She really enjoyed them both.   -- We finished with an app called "The Shit" and my girlfriend got some strawberry mochi. The Shit was the shit. I believe it was baked spicy zucchini sticks stuffed with spicy crab.   Overall, you have to come here. Especially if you live in the Northwest Vegas area!

nAh9BR5_kCVDVMvMp-dv7A.text: Came here for AYCE lunch on a Saturday. Had a pleasant experience. Nigiri have great fish to rice ratio. Fish was fresh and tasty. In addition to sushi, I also ordered the Salmon Kama which is highly recommended. Very juicy and tender and the sauce that comes with it is light and lemony.  Service did not disappoint me either. Constant checkups and drink refills.    Kudos to the waiter that serviced me, I was a bit inquisitive asking many questions regarding items on the menu. He was very patience with me and answered all my questions with a smile, never appearing he was in a rush.   All in all, it was a good experience and I will be back with company.

xbhVJj625Oz7ozgSLFuGZQ.text: Went for my birthday 2 weeks ago and still thinking about how great it was! Great staff and even better sushi...some of the best I have had in town! Presentation was beautiful and AYCE comes with Ramen too!!!

b-yIGtMg3iFTuVZfE4rdtg.text: What a gem in the north desert. I stayed in this part of town this time and was looking for sushi after 9pm. Read other helpers reviews and could tell from the menu that this was my place. The food is as delicious as it looks. Incredibly well plated.   I was surprised to see how many people order non-sushi dishes so I went all sushi and was so pleasantly surprised.   Screaming O - invented in Las Vegas and I love how each restaurant has their own spin. I freaking love this dish and always order when available as no one in Cali makes anything close. Five star worthy. Tuna is fresh, sauce has that ponzu bite with a subtle spice.   Carson roll- spider roll on crack. Soft shell crab with scallop,uhhh yeah!!!!  I will be back to try the other dishes. That's all for now.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carson roll with masago eggs
Photo of Umami - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Snapper
Photo of Umami - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Screaming O. Gorgeous presentation.

8jQY8qoLHf_MWg-UY0CvqQ.text: Why you should come here:  Cause you hungry for some solid Japanese food, and Umami's got it!  Where's it located?  Same area as Buffalo Wild Wings/Zaba's  What you should order: Depends what you're feeling...pretty wide variety here, from sushi to Ramen and even hot entrees too...  We started off with some Wasabi Tako and Amberjack Yuzu Truffle which was very tasty. We also split the Lobster Ramen which had spiny lobster tail, shrimp, scallop, mussel, bamboo shoots, shiitake mushrooms and scallions and a very generous portion of noodles.  Great flavors, but be prepared for some heat as it is in a spicy seafood broth.  You can't come here and not order sushi??? Wifey got an Avocado Roll, I had to have my Uni, and we got the Ocean Trout off the specials board...we were undecided on a roll on the  menu, so Chef Kim offered to make us a special no-name roll which had soft shell crab and shrimp tempura inside, wrapped in soy paper,  and topped with salmon and hamachi. All sushi tasted very good, generous cuts, and we were stuffed!  There's an Entree section that offers stuff like Chilean Sea Bass, Korean Shortribs, and  Hanger Steak if you're not feeling the raw stuff.  We got their popular Strawberry Champagne Cake and an Affogato to share. Cake was like boxed mix and I didn't taste any champagne,  but it was made with real buttercream. Good first visit,  and thank goodness for this place, because there's very slim pickings for sushi up here in the hills! Just be prepared to pay more than all you can eat prices because everything here is a la carte...ALOHA!!!  Shaka Meter: \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  4

sKioJ13CUhtZbz039iZ1GA.text: Very interesting,  What I ordered was very good.  Good food.  Did the all you can eat.  Only problem was if you ordered something that had to be cooked/fried it took forever.   Even desert was yummy.

RpQ80Nu4QOeZCTjDHskMLA.text: This place has a great ambiance to it! Great friendly workers! Love the customer service that this place has!   As for the sushi, they have a huge variety and have the option of AYCE. We tried so many, but the roll I remember most was the Bam Bam roll! I absolutely enjoyed that roll and all the other rolls we ordered. They definitely do not skimp put on the fish neither! My all time favorite is the yellow tail. All in all you can't go wrong at this place. Everything from the udon noodles down to the sushi was delicious!   The only downside was that I wish there were more "real" sushi on the menu, meaning more variety of raw fish in their rolls. There were salmon, tuna and spicy tuna that wefe in the rolls. So for those who can't eat raw, this is the place for you.  Overall, I wouldn't mind coming here again.

OykyELzh_7dhwasli2uu8w.text: The atmosphere was good. Plenty of staff on hand. Portions were a tad on the small side but everything was good. There were some miss communication but they corrected it and adjusted the bill. Over all it was an 8 out of 10.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4ewzQn-NKvIR0oxO0DLqzw.text: All you can eat sushi for around $20! You literally can't beat it. The sushi the best sushi I've ever had and I can't wait to go back. Get the baked lobster roll it's to die for!

l1tGKqsevy_6K9dl0uOktw.text: We tried this restaurant almost one year ago, we left underwhelmed and disappointed.  Over the weekend we gave it another try and were pleasantly surprised.  It was unrecognizable of the "old" restaurant. This restaurant is now welcoming, friendly and upbeat. There were drink specials and Marcelo our waiter was outgoing and made amazing food and drink suggestions which was appreciated. Orders are submitted on an iPad and comes out lightning fast. They have AYCE and the fish to rice ratio on the nigiri is generous.  The positive changes to this establishment are astonishing and will keep people (me) coming back. Well done!

o-f9iU_q5fl3k9WTf0mvrQ.text: Great Place!! Quality food!! Marcelo and Caesar were awesome! Friendly and top notch service food atmosphere and everything!!

Photo of Umami - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked scallop roll!! Bomb!! Thanks Marcelo and Ceazer for great service and suggestions on what to order!!

e8WG8xOZcboQ7QW2P7-3fA.text: This is the best Sushi restaurant in North-West Las Vegas!   As a sushi connoisseur myself, I truly believe that all sushi restaurants are the same, more or less, most sushi restaurants all taste the same to me. But Umami sets the bar. They are fast and the fish quality is great!  My husband and I come here once a week (Yes, once a week... I think the waiters and sushi chefs know us). You would think going that often one would be sick of sushi, but they have a wide variety of menu selections, the options are not limited. They offer rice/meat bowls, poke, and sushi burritos as well. Their all you can eat pricing is about $21 for lunch and $26.00 for dinner.  I would drive across town from Henderson to Centennial Hills just to get Umami sushi!

3iRwyMxIaxUQqqyJ6p5u6g.text: Big, fat extra star to bring them up to 5/5. Best sushi place in the northwest.  The service here got a MAJOR upgrade with the new manager. All of the staff are super friendly, fun, and on the ball with your orders. Total 180, so major kudos to the new manager and the staff, especially Ceazer who is a rock star.  They also upgraded the decor and music so it doesn't feel like you're eating in a Soviet gulag playing nu-metal to torture its prisoners. Much more inviting, and the music is mostly k-pop, which is fun. The seating also got changed to accommodate more people.  The food is still amazing with the most generous fish to rice ratio in the northwest, and always fresh fish. Their uni is flat out outstanding for AYCE. Only small food complaint is the tempura there needs work. It tends to be pankcakey instead of light and kinda greasy as it should be. It's gotten a bit better, but it's got a ways to go.  Get your butt over there and tip your servers well!

jR7R-o-Cv3kA8sR3mdZMlg.text: Came here last night with the wife for a good late Friday night dinner in Vegas.  It was pretty busy when we came around 9 PM as last order in is at 10:30 PM and neither of us really wanted to be rushed.  Maybe it gets a lot more crowded during peak dining times but no real worries there.  They even had people coming in after 10(close at 11) wanting to sit and they did warn them about not having a whole lot of time to dine.  The food is good and I must say that the nigiri we got had extra large pieces of fish on it compared to the amount of rice under which is always a good thing.  This is the 2nd place we have gone to where there is an item menu called *the Shit* and while not as good as the other, I would never complain about it.  The menu is quite extensive especially with the appetizers and the above mentioned nigiri fish.  The only thing I was not a huge fan of was I tend to order a plate of daikon radish and the chef kind of put like 3 times the amount I usually get so I really hated wasting what I could not finish because of everything else.    If you come early or very late,  you can actually get a chance to talk to your server about whatever without them trying to rush off and make tip money from other customers.

gQCgExO-RK8E3ZsLETA_lQ.text: Bummer Umami. I really really liked you. You were great. Until i had a hair in my sushi. Thanks for the replacement piece hair free though after i was grossed out.

mS8ARrv7_YgZcGloAEeN6w.text: Not a huge fan of AYCE sushi in general, but Umami's extensive menu and fresh fish does is right.  I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of fish and menu offerings.  Will be back if I find myself in that part of town again.

kYacODyqoWBsU2026iVOvQ.text: Great sushi. Highly recommended for the folks around centennial hills. The lemon salmons and Hawaiian rolls are the bomb!

photos.caption: Photo of Umami - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MHoSvbwBJb9GNMD5xw--2g.text: The husband and I come here often (probably more than we would like to admit) and each time we've been here, the service has been great.  Our server is especially friendly and easy to talk to and our orders always come out in a timely manner.  This is probably the best AYCE sushi this side of town in our opinion.  I think what makes this place a winner is the fish to rice ratio.  They don't overload your nigiris with a huge amount of rice and the fish is fresh.  This is probably the number one reason why we keep coming back here and the fact that its so close to home.  No need to drive down to Chinatown for some good sushi.     Not only is the sushi here pretty good but the service that we have received has always been impeccable from the sushi chefs down to the waiters.  The husband is always striking conversations with them.  Too much sometimes that I have to nudge him and tell him to chill out and let them work LOL. But what can I say, he loves to talk...and take shots ;)  The ambiance of the restaurant itself is like most other sushi restaurants.  We especially like the big japanese mural that they have on wall.  Parking itself can be pretty tight but we've never had any issues personally with finding parking.  Definitely a good ayce sushi spot this side of town.

g1-U4pX4tanEafJv5lL-Zg.text: Umami was amazing! Best all we could eat sushi we have had in a while and grateful it is in the Centennial area.   We have been before a couple years ago and it was a completely different experience. The food and service was so good that we have already told friends and made plans to go again.  The nigri was absolutely delicious. Perfect portions and everything we ate was delicious!   I recommend sticking to Japanese style food and getting the fresh wasabi to go with your meal.   All you can eat dinner starts at 3pm and it's about $26 per person.

tgVp5iPU_j2mUekyiLATEg.text: Firstly, great sushi place! Highly recommended! The nigiris are greatly proportioned with a huge slice of fish compared to the rice but the flavors are very well balanced. Their rolls are diverse in choices and choices. I recommended the Batman hand roll, very tame and subtle but a nice addition to the table. The fish is fresh and flavorful and you wont help yourself but order multiple nigiri and rolls. The eel sauce in the unagi is nicely done, that's why I ended up getting a lot of them. The side dishes and appetizers are also good options, like the calamari and fried gyoza, and the beef fried rice is also a good option. Their desserts are also pretty diverse; they have the usual option of ice cream and mochi but they also have the honey toast and fried bananas which I really appreciate. Overall, the experience is great and would highly recommend it. The only thing I guess I took the star off of is the location; but that's just me since I live at the Valley and often used to great places for sushi at Chinatown. Of course the place has a lot of regulars, but honestly even if it's a long drive I would not mind going back here again.

yhFZt3XQ6SOzc2z33ArMqg.text: Hostess needs some training on how to seat. We came in with our names on the yelp waitlist with 1 party ahead of us...a party of 1 who was seated and the hostess said we were next. There were multiple 2 tops open, yet we waited for 10 minutes, meanwhile another party of 2 and then a party of 7 came in. This seemed to fluster everyone and instead of seating us they waited until more tables cleared and set up for the party of 7. Then hostess finally comes back and says "who is the next party of 2?" and I say we are--since we most definitely were--then a woman behind me says no they were here first. Her husband corrects her, however, hostess shouldn't even ask that, she should know who is next. Then I see her seat the party of 7 before that other couple who was there first, then finally them. What is important as a hostess is to stagger when you seat people and not all at once so server and kitchen doesn't get overloaded with a bunch of orders going in at the same time.  Anyways, thank goodness the food came out really fast and was delicious. Crispy rice has a super tiny amount of spicy tuna unfortunately, but what there was tasted amazing. My husband really liked his "I Love Lobster" roll, just beware menu says it is 8 pieces but it is really 5.  Will probably return because the food tasted great, just hope the service will be better next time.

TKWx0YivjA120uE_P5c9Yg.text: This use to be our place but Never again. They changed the menu, food and service. Something changed drastically and it's no longer good. My kids love Nigiri sushi but all of the sushi was stringy and the color was wrong. After a few bites they said something was wrong. All of the sushi rolls tasted different too. Service has went downhill. Our server kept asking what we were missing, referring to what items we hadn't gotten yet and we kept having to let him know. We also ordered a half roll and it came out a full roll. When they require you to eat everything you order this does make a difference.

owvWZlKRrOwfFLiz_gv-gQ.text: This is probably the best sushi place I've been to. First time here and definitely will be back. Friendly and service was attentive. Sushi was fresh and clean. Have to give everything a try.

178h78bl-VYig51TOe80xQ.text: Higher end prices but food was awesome. We will go back again. Its a great experience

6CU3EBHzVdTdf5t5ndUkAg.text: I went here for lunch one day -- it was amazing!  I got the Ramen combo and it was sooooo good.... and soooo much food.  I got a cucumber salad (yum!), a giant hand roll, and a huge bowel of ramen.  I think I ate MAYBE 1/2 the food.  Probably less.  It was easily two meals for me.    Everything was well flavored and well cooked.  The noodles had a nice bite to them and the broth was really flavorful.  I went with four stars instead of five because I would have liked an option for a smaller lunch portion at a lower price point.  It was just so much food... and a little more than I like to pay for lunch.  BUT, simply based on the food - five stars.  If you're hungry for Japanese food, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it.

xQVH3wOyK3eImIEycksJTA.text: Outstanding service and quality food. The music is upbeat and a good mix of modern and classic hits.

pAb-expeL9XpcK2ao_ZgsQ.text: Casual Japanese restaurant with a fun menu. All the sushi names will make you laugh. You have option to choose All You Can Eat or order ala carte. The bentos have plenty of food, complete with your choice of protein, California roll, salad, soup, tempura, and gyoza. Would definitely recommend going for an affordable Japanese meal.

ZmS7-EVXTAGNFBQHqfge6Q.text: Loved this place! Invited my BFF here earlier this month for her birthday lunch and she was so happy with our experience.  It's a cool, contemporary spot--the samurai wall painting is a great backdrop.  Darin was our server who made sure service was top-notch. We started with the king crab and lobster ngiri, which were that day's specials. Both were delicious and generous; the lobster especially tasted like FRESH lobster, not an overbrined version that some places serve. Then we were going to have separate lunch special bowls of ramen, but because we already had sushi and were getting another roll plus pickled cukes, Darin mentioned that the ramen bowl was very large and filling and asked if we wanted to split it. Good thing we followed his lead because we would have wasted so much--instead, it was a perfect serving of umami miso ramen for each.  BFF received a beautiful complimentary tempura ice cream cake dessert served topped off with a birthday candle!  I felt prices were reasonable for the selections and quality, as our lunch bill was only $35, not including tip.  BFF is bringing her guy here and I'm taking hubby along next visit, too.

DAhGBSNrwF3Iyo8G8WmULw.text: This would be our 4th time eating at this location. By far the best atmosphere for Sushi. It's a small location but doesn't ever feel overcrowded. Awesome food, they have similar if not same type of popular rolls from other locations. The tempura calamari is delicious with tempura shrimp! This experience was amazing. We had 5 all you can eat and 2 of them did Ramen as well! ( They always ask you if your sure! ) lol don't doubt your food. It's delicious and you guys with just saying it's a Bday you guys made it a experience we will never forget! The desert was awesome!! And a great surprise! Thanks you for making it personal and not just a sushi dinner. Will always come here from now on.

6F8XqyDpDaGkQjNLSxDMUw.text: New favorite sushi restaurant! This place is great with amazing fish to rice ratio for an ayce place! Everything is seasoned well and fish is super fresh.

3uzEv1fKQk7znwd1rmu3cw.text: My sisters and I love Umami! It's close to home and the service is always on point. I'm a fan of the nigiri and how they don't put so much rice. Definitely recommend if you live near the centennial hills area.

WyjhT-L7FvZPvdFcwxe61A.text: We tried this place out for the first time tonight. It was my 8 year olds birthday! He's a sushi lover! I called at 6:30pm and asked if there was anyway we could have a table for 9 around 7:00pm. The employee on the phone was very nice and said she would try to figure something out. When we got there they had a beautiful table set up to fit all 9 of us comfortably. The service is some of the best I have had in a  sushi place we never had empty drinks and the food kept on coming. The food was also amazing the sushi was all fish hardly any rice. Some of the best sushi we have had. At the end of our dinner they brought the birthday boy a beautiful dessert and sang to him. He loved it! Thank you so much for making my boys 8th birthday amazing. I wish I could give you guys 10 stars.

oV4P91Bn7y1gfxDAPKmJvA.text: I love Sushi, but I feel having to wait for over an hour to be sat and told it would only take 20 minutes...Seems that their host doesn't know how to properly inform people on wait times. We also had multiple groups sit before us. I get it, we were a group of four and most of those groups were only two people, but still a little ridiculous.

YHWUxmtUQx95qM0bG49V0w.text: My friend and I visited this place for the first time the other day. Since we both were huge fans of nigiri than sushi rolls, we mostly ordered fresh nigiris through our server. The food was delicious and fresh. They have various kinds of menu selection. I'd highly recommend their fresh oyster, salmon kama, yuzu yellowtail, and salmon smoked paprika. I've tried a couple AYCE sushi places in Vegas but I'd say Umami is my favorite one! All the servers were very attentive and friendly. They came up to our table to see if everything was alright, bussed empty dishes right away which I was really impressed by. I'll definitely come back

BaTep5krryiY3CHzHxsQqg.text: Holy delicious!!! I have lived in Asia and can be extremely picky about my food. While this place is not strictly Japanese, Chinese, or Korean food it is still delicious.   They offer an all-you-can-eat option and I highly recommend it. You can order anything on the menu but make sure you ask for a half order!   I am allergic to shellfish and the waiter helped me pick out a few that I would be able to have. You need to try the Bam Bam Roll!!  The Spicy Garlic Edamame is delicious!  The sauce served with the gyoza is delicious too. Their version of Bulgogi is good too; it has a sweet taste to it but it is delicious.   They offer a military discount of 10% too.  There is no baby changing station in the bathroom.

-xlmk-A5mrK4GaNH5hL9ng.text: Food is amazing!!! New favorite sushi spot! Ceazer is our sever and he is always so attentive!

NyqK4WdXtLtvyDf0NR4LTg.text: My favorite sushi spot, excellence service, fast, friendly, nice atmosphere definitely gonna keeping coming to satisfy my sushi cravings!

QJsRdlw0pTa4IVaO-luB_Q.text: If I could give minus stars I would. We were excited to try this place and probably should have left when they got even out waters wrong, does anyone else like someone else's lipstick on their cup? No ? Me either! I ate my husbands appetizers hadn't even come out they got everything wrong. Couldn't even ring us up right . Ended up paying 24.99 for next to nothing and I left a 4.00$ tip and they didn't tell us even on a party of two they include gratuity so we left an almost 9$ tip for someone who didn't know left from right this place is a fucking joke .... refund should be given ..... don't waste your time

zLMHYurrsY2pNrHiIScVyw.text: Words can't express how happy I am that this place is here. I'd dined at the restaurant before but felt it was too expensive to get full. Sure the fish was fresh and the service efficient, just no comparison to an ayce restaurant. Now this is an ayce restaurant! I had to fight back tears when I quickly recognized the menu from Sushi Neko. It's my favorite ayce in Vegas. Now I have the wonderful luxury of this place being right down the road from my house. Everything I ordered was exactly like ordering from Sushi Neko. The insane rice to fish ratio, the variety of no-rice rolls, the amazing nigiri sauces, and "the shit." I love the salmon belly nigiri, smoked paprika salmon, super white, scallop, and garlic tuna. The shit and shrimp tempura are favorites too. There's not one bad thing I can say about my visit here. My waiter, Carlos was fun and suggested other menu items he thought we'd like. He was spot on! The service was excellent, many plates brought out and empties taken away. I have found my new sushi place!

NMjzot3EBulAaOov06Y5rw.text: The sushi was very good and the service is outstanding. Our servers where very attentive and not over bearing. The restaurant is also very clean.

d32jZe-Xm_KDdt-jO5ncKQ.text: We go here all the time! The service is always great very fast! The sushi tastes wonderful I normally do all you can eat and my partner does a bento box which is very sizable! Live everything here from the decor to the food and especially the reasonable prices

9dj3PUMEqZPs-IGlEjhcjw.text: Great selection of sushi and great service. You can't beat their all you can eat price!

QSIVyQPIBAkkjM4KH2MefQ.text: First time here, came in on a tuesday night around 7 and it was a little busy. Party of 4 of us and we waited only about 10 minutes and had a lovely spot at the sushi bar.   Service was very attentive and made sure all our needs were met. My family and I all did AYCE and shared all our different things! There is a sushi roll with peanut butter and at first I was hesitant but YOU MUST TRY!! It was delightful the different tastes jumping around in your mouth!   Overall pricing was good for the quality of food and service, would recommend to every friend!

s2twqZK79qIqaUR4Yy-VOg.text: Rice to fish ratio on their sushi is the best in town! Almost no rice at all!!!!!!Ate their tonight with 2 of my close friends, very friendly atmosphere!. Service was fast&excellent.   Our waiter (elizabeth) attended our table and was very informative on the menu and even recommended us some great options!     My favorite is the garlic tuna and uni. Would definently recommend for people that dont want alot of rice, and not sacrifice quality.

dd_B0kdlM-2O1jrUBo3peA.text: I really enjoyed my dining experience at Umami! This place is very modern/urban with chill/cool vibes. The menu offers a variety of different things to try & the service is spectacular. My mother and I came for dinner AYCE (the price is extremely reasonable, #DoAYCE!). The servers are very kind & caring, they will literally pop up out of no where to take your order! In other words, they are making sure you leave stuffed haha. ALSO If you happen to have any allergies, just bring it up and the staff is very knowledgeable of the menu items.   It's nice to see the staff enjoying work, they were always smiling/cheerful. OVERALL: Great staff+Great food=My family returning!!   Way to go Umami :)

Dz2XLJYCnCsJDhD7B54r8A.text: Fantastic!!! A hidden gem amongst many restaurants. You need to try the rolls with what looks like hot Cheetos on top! I was feeling adventurous and also tried a roll with PEANUT BUTTER?! It was pretty interesting...  I can't wait to go back and try more food from their awesome menu! Also, try "The Shit!" You won't regret it.

BSYDm0PzCHD4hkrIbAvcfw.text: Came here again last week. My mom and I ordered Ramen. Ramen was Ok. There was not as much stuff as I normally get at another Ramen place like IChi Noodles House on W. Tropical Pkwy. However, it was not bad overall for the price itself.  This place is good for sushi and Japanese combo boxes.

ycaS6EYHj6BvfYUH5pG3nA.text: Some of the best sushi I've had. Everything was super fresh, and well made. The AYCE was awesome and service was top notch. The server made recommendations on things to try and was very attentive. I'll definitely be back.

IXRfFCxFpCS8__vSVfRTXQ.text: I had high hopes for this sushi restaurant. I heard good reviews from a friend and it looked like it was pretty busy. I love sushi restaurants and have been to many out here in Vegas. When I ate here I started with a bottle of sake like I normally do at sushi restaurants. My sake came a long piece of hair in it. The sushi I ordered was very oily to the point It completely ruined the taste. The service was ok but I would recommend Krazy sushi that is down the street or Sapporo Revolving sushi that's not too far from this restaurant.

BqTqWd7qe8R4YrMZlVlV-w.text: Best Sushi house in Las Vegas. Value is better. Service is great! Taste is Great. Don't miss out try it now.

4gVROR6UWAeACIQC_GjIoQ.text: No just no. Bit into a slimy scallop that still had the mud vein in it. Then the chef had a problem with me for telling him. Potential food poisoning likely here.

qlk2NIAHANGUo39gMbhwmA.text: Great place! I get to order half rolls with all you can eat. So I'm able to try more rolls than usual. Love it!

3tPBKsk0UObcc5QRLWC0WA.text: Fresh salmon, Salmon eggs (Ikuda), fresh water earl (Unagi). Best place in Las Vegas.

q_YerSa1Ooc96socyEOi2w.text: Every time I come here, the service and portions continue to go downhill.  The all you can eat feels wasted because at a certain point, the quality makes it so you feel like you no longer want to keep eating.

QC_UpUY3076D8E0LoorGWw.text: Love this place and the service. Vibe is super cool. You can usually always over hear a super awkward date going on next to you which makes a great meal entertainment. Food is amazing!

aw240bhP6HVdlvQhy8JPxg.text: How yummie is this place ?!?!  Love the variety of non raw they have for weirdos like me!  Great service and delicious food. All you can eat price of lunch is great also-- highly recommend-- can't wait to go back!

erUlvC4iFXk_I-4Y1tpb3g.text: This place is awesome. Ever since our sushi spot changed owners we left because the food was not good.  I than found this place and being in Japan as many times that I have before I felt like it was as close as you can get. Coco curry is amazing but this curry is on point.  Joseph is awesome too. The hair is also on point. I definitely will make the 15 minute drive to come feast like a barbarian with it's affordable all you can eat menu.

Aoad_Ahv90X_ewzYvu6n4Q.text: The sushi and service was good, super sad they changed the menu and it pretty much only caters to AYCE. We're not AYCE people so it was hard to chose which was which and the menu pretty much makes to want to do AYCE. I wanted udon and on the menu it only offers it now with the AYCE. So I had to ask for a special order and it was a tiny bowl! We came here a few months ago before the renovation and it was delicious. Probably not going to come back

IaNioVu_rtM7X0CL22_1Yw.text: Great service and quality fish! Don't need to go down to Spring mountain anymore.  Virtually same quality as Sushi Neko :) Awesome place.  My go-to sushi restaurant now!

G9r8hQFIAqtLIv95kz8a9w.text: Nice intimate atmosphere with a huge tv screen tv wall.  Nice place to mingle and enjoy sushi.  Staff was friendly was a great place to celebrate my birthday in November with close friends.

-m8Fs6gKfBEW-PbuUqe7AQ.text: My go to place for all you can eat! Food is delicious. I would always go to sushi neko so I'm glad this place is only 5 minutes away from me!  The night we went, there was one server, one food runner and one busser. They all worked together and were able to give us our food on time and always made sure our glasses were filled. Service is excellent.

fGf5ZK6l23i82BwEt8FjBw.text: I took my adopted daughter in law there for her bday June 20th for lunch. . It was fabulous! Caleb our waiter was very professional and he kept coming back to our table and asking us if we needed anything else? Not overbearing! My daughter in law wanted sushi and they did not disappoint. Price was good and we had leftovers! I highly recommend this place!

pBVeaYHJHum7xKkpc3XWEw.text: It's easy to overlook pricier sushi options when Vegas is full of All You Can Eat sushi places but if you could just tear yourself away from those places for one night, this place will remind you what if feels like to treat your taste buds to something of True quality. Not only is the fish fresh and far superior to any buffet style eatery out there but there is sincere thought put into every dish from the presentation to the sauce. Even the simple edamame appetizer is exploding with flavor. The chef here tastes pride in his work and it shows. You can't go wrong getting any of their sushi but if you want to try their other dishes, the Chilean Sea Bass is worth every penny.

b83fsrbK4Y577hRHS02hLg.text: This place has amazing selections, a classy atmosphere, but still casual enough to relax. Great prices. We love it!

zrlTxKZdQjZRF1U9eZ9dQw.text: This place is fantastic! Went with a party of 5 and had no problem getting seated. Decor is awesome and feels much higher end than a strip mall. My food was fantastic (short ribs) and rest of the group loved the sushi. I'm not a raw sushi fan but did love one of the cooked versions. Beautiful presentation and service was top notch. Dessert was fantastic which isn't always the case in sushi joints.

bZUUC-dK49mcACE7vA9l1A.text: Service was fine, broth was tasty and we really enjoyed our meal.

wK6d-6diMPH000L3bAoIfw.text: About time some more culture has come to Centennial Hills. My new favorite restaurant in the area. Quiet atmosphere, pleasant staff. Food the short ribs very tender and tasty. We went two days in a row. Also the chashu ramen is like prescription drugs for the soul, yummmm good.

ed0czIQi8U0O26ZP-Bftqg.text: Came in at 2pm to try the ramen combo and I have to say it's a great price for the amount of stuff you get ( salad, 1 roll, and 1 generous amount bowl of ramen ) we ordered another specialty roll cause we didn't think $12 ramen combo would be enough but man I'm coming out stuffed.  Great atmosphere and very attentive server ( sure we were the only ones there haha but I'm guessing since it's a Tuesday and 2pm.  Still this place should get more business it's great ). Will come back again to try some dinner stuff next time.

wD8Qiz_FQgiCzWUTKH1cRw.text: I went here for the first time and I was blown away with how good everything was and how great the customer service was. It's a really good sushi spot to go to if you're in the north side. Our server Nina was amazing! She recommended the peach sake.. it's def a must try!

eQgE3boqpHyh2KqL-pL__A.text: This place is fabulous!! I am so glad we finally have a delicious sushi restaurant here in Las Vegas!! Our waitress was very friendly always had a smile on her face and our service was super fast. The chefs make delicious sushi! Highly recommend the spicy crab roll, Sunset roll, and tiger roll. Teriyaki chicken and rice was also a delicious entree. Prices are well within budget and I would highly recommend this place if you're looking for delicious food :)

wcer2Ype68m9J9hCKbEQsg.text: Such a Great place to go. Very nice and polite Staff.  I had the shrimp tempura Udon special and it was delicious.

Tw6wFw6pEl0Tl7Y7Hemn3Q.text: Visited Umami today on recommendation of other Yelp reviewers, and so glad we did. When vacationing in Maui, one of our favorite delicacies is Yellowtail Kama. Until today, we haven't found any as good. Umami's is better!  The rolls we had (California roll with masago; spicy tuna) were rich in flavor. We can't wait to return and tour the rest of the menu...

XAYZ1Mjz0WdZuqk9SS6BJA.text: The spicy lobster ramen was delicious! Great flavor, lots of seafood (scallop, shrimp, mussels, and of course lobster tail), and bamboo, mushrooms, seaweed, egg. Everything I needed today! So glad it's close to home, not many ramen places in Centennial Hills.

i85HKk3IFBVkU9-g13dKtA.text: Centennial Hills has been a gastronomical wasteland forever.. That's beginning to change and UMAMI has alot to do with that. This is a relatively new place. It is terrific. Great food, varied menu, friendly and helpful staff.Neat place and ambience.For me it's only five minutes from my house, however worth a trip from other parts of town. Never knew that there was Japanese sausage. Well there is. And this appetizer was so good, that I ordered some to take home.A total winner.

2iB3TWHCwrEQzic0asY6dA.text: Amazing food. Amazing prices. Delicious.  Love the simple yet perfect menu. Something for everyone's likes from simple California roll to Japanese Lasagna to Sashimi. Kris was our server and was perfect. Very attentive and the good came very fast.

jnEKsk6CXCjrJcjGVhhgww.text: Ate here on a recent trip through town to celebrate our 30th anniversary.  When it came down to the day of the anniversary, we couldn't figure out where to go, and decided against going to the strip. We were looking for something light and not terribly expensive.  Umami was near where we were staying and the Yelp reviews were good.  Maybe it's because we are from Seattle and have good sushi all around, but I kind of felt "meh" about Umami.  It was SO dark inside that we could barely even see the menus or what we were eating--I've been in dark restaurants but it was kind of ridiculous.  And it started out kind of strange because it took a long time for anyone to take our order, even though the place was almost empty and we didn't get refills on our iced teas.  The sushi was good--we had a sushi appetizer, and I had the lobster ramen and husband had a fish dish (cooked).  It's been a couple of months so I don't remember exactly what it was. I do remember that we wished that there was some sort of combination where we could try a couple of different things.  We ended up switching meals halfway through because my ramen, while good, was VERY spicy.  We both enjoyed the fish very much.  Overall the food was fairly good, service was kind of mediocre,

B1lZvxkB_Jkbesc8blGQFw.text: Honestly the service here is amazing. All your food comes out so fast and the All You Can Eat is the best deal. My boyfriend and I have gone here several times and it has been just as amazing every time we go. Thank you to Mark!!

sVuTQWJ69tZvGx2YCKjyJQ.text: Fantastic all you can experience! Great service and tasty variety of rolls. Too many good rolls to try. Albacore delight was a great start and the stuffed tomato was to die for.

o_SiMdKRZ4u--xVWX1fV5Q.text: Still love this place. Had an incident yesterday but it has quickly been resolved.  So happy it was a fluke. Pls visit umami.

Jg9tdsFDlMoq8X3qINOgoA.text: We had an amazing time and the food was great! I was hesitant eating all you can eat but the food was greasy and tasty. This will definitely be a regular place for us.

DtxYxo5HSx7kNFBGGtBVMg.text: Finally! A delicious Japanese restaurant in the Durango, Northwest area!  Restaurant is quiet, clean, not much decor inside; very simple.  Food is really yummy! Their menu offers sooo many types of Japanese rolls - from raw to baked to fried. They have lunch and dinner 'combos', noodles, rice bowls, soups, salads. They also offer an All You Can Eat on all the rolls! If you're not a voracious eater, you can go the a la carte way.  We came around lunch time. The place wasn't filled up but we had to wait a couple of minutes before we were seated as there were only 2 hosts working that time. But once we got seated, service was fast. We didn't have to wait too long for the food. I'd say our food was served in less than 15 minutes; the rolls just a tad bit longer but it was soooo good it was worth the wait.  Price wise ($-$$), it's almost the same as other Japanese or sushi restaurants that have similar menu.  Highly recommend to visit and try!

3hNTGoY36nZzQI6uU0n3cg.text: This placed has changed to an AYCE sushi joint.  The food was ok, but did not seem as fresh as other local sushi restaurants.  The service was excellent.  We preferred the old menu selections.

jWPJQChkL8zEkxJRGvQY1Q.text: The service was pretty decent. A few people helped us through our dining experience and all of them were rather nice. The food was good. A nice change of pace from where we usually go, but at the same time it wasn't "outstanding". Fairly typical. I feel I want to try to eat here again to better gauge how their food is. However, the fish to rice ratio really stood out above other places. Everything came out at a reasonable pace and even surprisingly quick at points. We went around 5:30 so even though people were there it wasn't crazy. The prices are average, but I do think the place we typically go is slightly more expensive by maybe a dollar or two. At the end of our meal is when more people started rolling in and you could tell come the usual dinner hour they probably get pretty busy. I'm curious to see how the service is during busier hours. All in all dinner left me with a curiosity to try to them again, but they don't particularly stand out so far.

zGgmLEpXUE8DCfnAAxJ4rQ.text: My go to place for all you can eat sushi that's by my house. The fish to rice ratio is awesome and the food is always good! Love the mural on the back wall too.

zeipWAGSQxZrbufSGdNZqw.text: We were so excited to find a good Japanese restaurant on our side of town. After trying it, I must say the verdict is mixed.   The ambience is beautiful. Lot of space, beautifully and professionally decorated.  It looks very upscale. The staff was nice.   The food was not great, but not bad either. We ordered sushi, tempura ice cream, ramen, and karaage chicken. The sushi rice was a tad colder and harder than what we're used to. Fish was OK. Chicken was warm and not piping hot as most other good places. But the sauce was very interesting and delicious.   Service was work in progress. It was very busy. And our dishes were taking a bit longer. One was completely forgotten.  And other guests' dishes were repeatedly offered to us.   We will give it another chance once the dust settles.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon skin roll

7bYMdntz7MJGeXGg0FE0pQ.text: This Sushi restaurant in our area has been open for approximately 1 year. The service is top notch. We have never had a bad experience here and the food is delicious.   We would recommend this restaurant to everyone and anyone we come in contact with.

jBRyJrc9BL8jDz8dVKy-DA.text: Came here with 5 coworkers.. half aren't into sushi.. but hey found something else and loved it! It was Halloween night so they had "pumpkin cake" on the house that was amazing! Great service and the "rock and roll" roll was my fav!

hGWVguXa4fGG8ARRV08aoQ.text: Had some take out from this place. An order of egg rolls and some spicy miso ramen. It was affordable and delicious! If we had more time we would have definately sat down for dinner. The menu is pretty extensive, lots of things to try next time!

wbecUe791Fw0Qv_ewuHyvg.text: Went to Umami recently... it was my 3rd trip there in the last 2 months. Each time I have gone my family and other families we are with really enjoyed it.  They have great lunch and dinner specials and the staff is fantastic.  The other night when we were there a lady was trying to do the All You Can Eat and feed all of her kids on the 1 ticket. Umami management told her that she couldn't do that, she blew a gasket and left.  The Umami manager came over and explained the situation to us since we were sitting close. He didn't have to do that because we already understood and felt Umami was right.  Later he comp'd us a few generous items. YEAH!!  Anyway, Umami food and sushi is great, I love the atmosphere and it is now my regular sushi place!  Cheers to Umami!

mUDSopix1bXBjxqFhGkSnA.text: Super awesome restaurant. My wife and I eat sushi all the time and have been looking for a restaurant closer to our house. The staff and their sushi chef we're super friendly. Some of the freshest fish and very clean. They always treat us awesome and also treat our kids amazing. If I could I would give this place 10 stars. Yun is the manager and he makes us feel like we are in our own house eating. Great place for all kinds of occasions.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Oj8DRozIee9Owmv7gr8sqA.text: Who would have thought that a sushi restaurant in Centennial hills would be this good! I don't usually write reviews but had to for this restaurant. If you know good quality sushi then you know their pricing is reasonable. Quality of fish was fresh and presentation was excellent! Service was also excellent and the staff made sure you were taken care off! We will be back soon!

r7bdZTnZ5-q7JeXNUCkx8w.text: Great service, atmosphere, food, AND prices! The bento boxes are so much food and everything is priced really well. I had a mini girls night with a friend who needed it aaaaand it was perfect! We had the Knights hockey game on, pear sake, Sapporo beer, and amazing food! I had a sushi roll topped with jalapeno and tuna....holy crap YUM! I'll be going back for sure. Even if the service sucked next time, I would not stop going haha

H9o-hmQOe81X8xIXYhpMOg.text: This was my first time here and I loved it. I loved the fact that all you can eat was only $26 and they had about 50 items on the menu. I didn't order that much but the server still let me take some of it home. He stated with the all you can eat you're not allowed to take it home and they charge you for leftovers. As I did not eat as much he made an exception which was amazingly kind. I will be back soon

eQd6SASGqJNNgQnNzfY0QQ.text: My wife and I are eating here as I write this. Umami is truly a  righteous ALYCE SUSHI restaurant. Great choice with very fresh Nigiri. I am having some salmon belly right now. Buttery heaven. For 26.95 with a 80 minute time limit the value is right on. We love it. You will love it too.

IMhU7Vj57h6SjxUqdreflQ.text: I'm very satisfied with this restaurant..Very good sushi variety,good portion quality..and good presentation..Service is also very good..Over all good atmosphere. Another big plus is that ayca sushi comes with a bonus of free hot/cold sake..all you can drink..Awsome! Keep up the good work you guys.. I've been to many sushi restaurants and now I don't mind driving 18miles just to get there..

Fs_ETAG9AKMyv93a6IqiCw.text: Great food and service. Mango ceviche is one of a kind. The sea urchin was delectable.
