wxHnO0KDVrRSPFjDejtLrw.text: Great sushi thanks to Ray! Super welcoming vibes here. Everyone was so kind. Still haven't finished our dinner but I had to write a review while I had a moment! Can't stop ordering the " Red Bull" roll! Thanks everyone! We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Umami - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2DtPSInPKtTw3RUDTI44Lw.text: We went for lunch on Sunday. Hamachi kama was really good. Other items are reasonably fine. Good price.

OjcK133sbk8fGQONFt9kuA.text: Umami is a must try sushi spot. They're food was amazing and customer service was over the top. My wife and I sat at the bar and the sushi chef was constantly checking if we needed something. My wife also wanted something spicy but she couldn't decide what and the chef suggested the poke salad and said he could make it spicy and it was phenomenal. Definitely a must go to restaurant and we will be going back many more times.

5NrNnxNwNo6KXg4XnyJfGg.text: Fresh sushi. Best I've had in Vegas off the strip. Fast service too! Will def be back for the AYCE again

LIeSr8cD1pk-1yUBuKUo1A.text: Been 3 times and will continue to go back. Each time we try new rolls and have yet to be disappointed. They of course have all the basics but their signature rolls are so unique. Service has been impeccable. Restaurant is clean and looks great.

0mS8JDKov84dF7rmWT63sg.text: Went in for lunch. Not a bad deal with the roll, salad and Ramen but honestly, the Ramen was underwhelmingly unspectacular. You go to Spring Mountain and get Ramen, there are all sorts of different options to add like butter, corn, spice levels, but this was pretty basic. Pork belly, egg, some kind of vegetable and scallions. The flavor was just okay too (got the spicy miso). Veg roll was tasty. Service was excellent. I just won't be getting the Ramen again.

xf3gpx9aSCxsZxNOd6B0cg.text: O.M.G. Eat here.  Fresh and delicious from start to finish!   Sleek decor. Attention to detail.  Clean. Reasonably priced.  Comfy seating. Spacious.  Check out original artwork on walls: amazing! Cannot wait to come back and eat more!

4YMdkFZF99fdiA7dPAHBKw.text: Delicious! Tried the the King Crab roll, the spicy salmon roll, and the crunch dragon rolls! All were fresh and tasty. Our server Caleb was fast, pleasant and efficient. Kim at the sushi bar is very friendly and knowledgeable!

f7H5uPEEuf7j5FSjHmnSQw.text: Awesome presentation with most fresh and sweetest sashimi I've had in North LV! Service was impressive. The restaurant ambience is surely a breath of fresh air compared to the new strip.  The place was exceptionally spacious come to think of it. Great location,  great food,  great service to be more particular for a small group and gathering. $$$ for a couple or few friends but you won't regret it!  They must be proud to serve their community.  I will come back with the family.

RMF48Bwv7jEHZjPoY9Y1bA.text: Excellent food. Very attentive. We ordered 2 apps, 4 rolls,  two beers, and 2 deserts. Only $75. Would go back and bring friends, enjoyed the atmosphere.

tEUzNb-zeioi5yYVmNlnpg.text: This was our first time stopping by.  The restaurant was pretty slow so our wait staff was extra attentive.  Food was ok, however, the service was superb, by far some best in this part of town in our opinion.  Great location too. After dinner we were able to shop in and around the nearby shopping center.  Looking forward to trying out more of the menu items. Two thumbs up.

TiScsqXcpDrmyZmbWK6OYg.text: This is a new place and I'm amazed on the quality of the food. Fresh fish and great cooked food too. I'm definitely coming back to this place and try the other items in the menu. Our server Stephanie was awesome. She's friendly and attentive to our needs. Anyone looking for a great sushi joint on the north side of town, this is the best place bar none.

2DHvqVgbqYZPT22tgyvkbA.text: We ordered the Grand Canyon, Red Bull, Carson, and Volcano roll. Didn't need to use soy sauce to enhance the flavor.  A smaller selection on the specialty rolls but so far so good. We will be coming back to try other rolls.

N0qNG1KBWbSW9xoc48VHKQ.text: Brought my father and son here for lunch on a weekday simply because it was conveniently located near the Centennial Medical Offices. What a great find. We thoroughly enjoyed every dish we ordered and the staff was extremely friendly. When in the area, I will definitely return!

9jiTCacBSjC6TCshfSxo6w.text: Terrible service. The person who "greeted" us was miserable, unfriendly & definitely not welcoming. Didn't say hello, didn't smile, just asked for our drink order and left without saying a word. She came back about 5 minutes later to bring our drinks & without saying anything she left them on the table & ignored our "thank you" & left. The restaurant was pretty empty, 5 tables including ours,  & 4 employees just lounging around. Server after server would walk around aimlessly, ignoring us and avoiding us. At one point one server was at the front cleaning menus, and another started to buss a table rather than approach us even though most of the restaurant tables were clean and open in case anyone happened to walk in. after 15 minutes we just got up to leave. No inquiry as to why we were clearly displeased and no goodbye on our way out. The servers acted like they did not give a damn so we didn't even stay to eat.

6Y_kGzZzKRCkyiTMNWrkOQ.text: This place really pisses me off!! Why? Well.. I've driven here twice now and the first time they were closed due to closing an hour early! Next, they put a sign out front saying they were closed (on super bowl). If I New I would've gone else where obviously!!! The dates and times for business are questionable. Call before driving there.

1OxLXbtqtzrAPWZ_YRPGKg.text: Friendly staff, great atmosphere and a very good selection of sushi. We came during lunchtime and sat at the bar. Not overcrowded and the background music wasn't overbearing. Our waitress was very attentive. She filled our waters and handed us more napkins without asking. I had the ramen lunch special with a choice of a roll and salad. Everything was delicious. We also ordered the baked green mussels, jalapeno poppers, and two rolls. szW9KoTUnY9U5QG0MD0f-w.text: This was our first time into Umami and it was fantastic. We got off a little late and arrived at 10:10pm. Lindsay was our waitress and was incredible. We asked when last call was and it's at 10:30pm. She never rushed us, informed us of their happy hour menu, and laughed with us and made us feel like we were regulars. cHeOV0_nPm4jfbeDPbVY0Q.text: Tried this with my sons and they loved it! The menu was so big they couldn't decide on what to get. We tried a little bit of everything and by far they liked the mini miso ramen. Our server was confused be cause we kept asking for the mimi ramen and I guess it was a typo, it was supposed to be mini ramen ha! The pace looked nice, modern decorations. They had a large screen TV showing show with Japanese chefs making sushi. It was interesting but seeing fish and squid being gutted while you eat is not my first choice of shows to watch during dinner.  Service was good all the other servers seem to help out other tables. The staff was great overall.  I'd probably come back again.

SeMHNFQdc7EPwcCpgw5xjw.text: One of my favorite AYCE sushi spots! Same owner/menu as sakana over by UNLV.  I like the selection of appetizers and sushi.  Fish to rice ratio for sushi pieces is excellent...meaning very little rice.  I don't usually eat rolls since there is too much filler and not enough fish.  For sushi selections, the salmon belly, unagi, seared salmon are my favorite nigiri.  I like that they also have riceless options or options wrapped in cucumber.  A little different than other spots that I didn't see a specials list for the day. The service was excellent and there was always someone checking to see if I needed to place more orders.  The kitchen was a little slow when I was there...so appetizers took much longer than nigiri.  I noticed some differences from Sakana.  The towering sashimi poke came out on tortilla chips and not wonton chips...a little weird tasting honestly.  One suggestion, the crab nigiri is one big imitation crab stick.  I would suggest doing a crab salad nigiri which would look a lot better than the one long stick on a piece of rice.  They were also out of hamachi kama and kurobata sausage the night I went.  I hope it's not a regular occurrence where they are out of items.  I get the hamachi kama is seasonal.  Seating was a little awkward, the tables were so close together, tables had to be moved for people to get in or get out of adjacent tables.  Also, orders kept getting mixed up and placed on adjacent tables.  Overall, the food is good and I like that they are on yelp so I can check wait time and put my party on the wait list as I drive over.  Kid friendly, it's pretty loud, so will drown out any crying children haha!

TWuK9V4epu5GNKUBu8l67Q.text: We stopped here not knowing it was sushi only (not a problem for me. My husband doesn't eat sushi). After waiting for about 20-30 on a very hungry stomach is when we realized they didn't have a typical dinner menu. Yet the waiter was fairly attentive and suggested a steak teriyaki dish. We decided to stay. My husband had two plates of the suggested dishes. So he obviously enjoyed.   I had a couple of issues with my sushi orders. A couple of wrong orders being delivered. One that took super long to arrive. As to my 4 star rating.   Overall the food was yummy and the service was okay for being a busy night.   Ps: i always get overwhelmed with the amount of sushi selection. I LOVE sushi but there are several topping that are a no no for me, so I would love to see a sushi place implement a build your own sushi. q4hhM5Et4u28Ku5qn9bwvg.text: Fifteen years ago we passed a pleasant afternoon at the Rio seafood buffet. That's long gone, so we looked for a replacement. Umami is it.   For $22 before 3pm, you can have all the sushi you can eat. This is not junky stale fish: it was fresh and prepared to order (and quickly!) take a look at the menu: they have the widest selection we've ever seen.   The only odd thing is twice when we ordered hamachi, we got Kama instead of nigiri. That's what happens when the selection is so broad, you have to be specific. Hamachi Kama was a first for us: a cooked hamachi tail and rather delicious.   So do what we did: skip breakfast, jump on your plane to Vegas and stop here on your way out of town to the national parks. It's a great way to start a road trip!

It is ok clean.  (I prefer an immaculate sushi restaurant...I mean, you know, RAW food being prepared).  The service is fine.  Did not stand out, but they were not rude.  It was nice of the chef to send over some dishes for free, as part of my group's AYCE.  But it was just not a place that I would feel comfortable returning to all the time.  The dishes were good, though.  We liked the fatty tuna (the chef special).  We liked the yellow tail and tuna.  We liked this one roll that was spicy, with cheese, avocado, and fried shrimp.  We liked this "Christmas" roll that had green and red sprinkles on top.  All in all, pretty good.

xOt6oKg4d32d6Llxc4bbyQ.text: Great place. Really, on the strip worthy type place, yet close to home. It has changed hands a few times over the past few years, but somehow has always been great.  Food: I'm vegan, so veggie rolls for me. Hubby is not vegan, but he loves this place more than I do. Very good food overall! Good rice to sushi ratio. They have a Wonder Woman roll that is fried shitake mushroom, cucumber, avocado inside and fish on top, but for extra $1 they modified it for me with avocado on top instead of fish (I'll try to attach a photo here). Beautiful and so delicious! Mini udon is vegan friendly. They also have skewers - mushroom, tofu. A few other items like edamame and seaweed salad for my vegan/vegetarian friends. I'm trying to encourage them to get a little vegan menu. ;) I'll be here way more often then!  Presentation: On point! Sharp, clean and elegant. Definitely gets the tastebuds going.   Vibe: Modern, dark colors, Japanese fusion with a sports bar. Really cool looking mural on one of the walls. A couple of booths, tables and of course sushi bar.   Service: Very friendly and accomodative staff. Didn't mind at all to check on preparation of certain foods for me. Very pleasant. Always served us very quickly.

F2JVnjvQ0taOI-9qIwtfUw.text: This new spot in town has my number! I came here tonight for a late dinner with my girlfriend and we were not disappointed in the least.  It was slow for a Friday night but being late I understand that could be the case in this quieter part of vegas. As soon as we walked in we were greeted and seated.  I personally like the bar so we found a nice corner. Drink orders were taken immediately and here we go.  The rundown: I ordered the screaming o and a no. 5 roll. Screaming o was placed with the waitress and came first and the attentive chef took my order for the roll which he made before my eyes.  The screaming o is a staple for me. I love it, it's great. Ask anyone that knows me, it's fantastic. In this preparation the chef portioned out the radish to fit the plate, then sliced it by the portion and proceeded to lay the tuna slices over it and drizzle the sauce. This struck me as different because when eating it ensured that each bite had the right ration of fish to radish to sauce with no biting and navigating of long pieces that typically would be nested on the plate. Rich, fresh, thoughtful. Everything I wanted.  The no. 5 roll has Cajun albacore and cucumber inside with spicy tuna and crispy onion on top with a light saucing. This was amazing in flavor and generous in fish. You could taste the Cajun albacore even under the topping and onion. A big bite for sushi but well composed.  All this with a Sapporo makes for a treat meal.  My friend tried my selections and loved the screaming o but was terrified of the roll, she is a bit vanilla. Her order was a California roll and gyozas and she was satisfied. The chef made us a delicious special after seeing the difference in our orders. It was a cut scallop bite with truffle oil and a fried garlic slice on top. It was so perfectly tender and the sweet hint of the scallop shined through.  All in all I was incredibly impressed and will be back!

hTq1ZIOCH2gNNvPciNfGVA.text: First time trying this place out.  Tuna Poke was awesome! Tried a few new rolls wasn't exactly our taste.  We didn't complain, however, the server sensed it and notified the manager. The friendly manager came out and was pleasant and we gave feedback.  She was professional and comped the rolls we weren't satisfied with. Overall nice atmosphere and great service.  I rated as 5 stars because the other rolls, beef bowl and tuna poke were great.

zgiIF84J43JJRfuabneCLg.text: Very disappointed with this place, especially seeing yelpers have given this place on an average 4.5 stars.   A 4.5 star restaurant should have excellent ambiance, excellent food, excellent service. This Umami place has none of the above.  First the ambiance, it is quite mod but cold. Seats are not comfortable and has many TV's. Is this really a Japanese restaurant or just a sports bar serving Japanese food??  Service is horrible not because the servers tried to ignore us, rather, they need to be trained: 1. There were empty tables along the wall and the aisle, instead, the seater took us to a table right in the middle of the room with empty tables all around us. Strange. 2. Three servers came to us to take drink orders and desert orders seems to be totally un-organized.  3. We ordered some sushi rolls. We have to ask for Wasabi and ginger which were not accompanied with the rolls. We should not have to ask for them -- it is a must condiment with sushi.  4. We asked for low sodium soy sauce. The waitress said there should be one in the kitchen but then she came back and said all the soy sauce they use are of the low sodium variety.  5. Server did not seem to know the menu well -- has to go and ask the chef/manager constantly. Annoying. Although all the servers were friendly and courteous, there is a lot of training to be done.  Now come to the food: A good Japanese restaurant must have good sushi rice as well as regular rice ( that come with the entrees ). This restaurant's rice is obnoxiously bad -- when sushi rice is hard and under-cooked, you just won't have good sushi.  We also ordered the BBQ short ribs. Way too much Korean BBQ sauce on those ribs.   Pricing on the food items is disproportionate. Classic rolls are only $6 each. But specialty rolls are about $15 each or more. Why such difference.   Based on the sushi rice, this place is not worth any thing more than a 1.5 star, but since there is no half star category,  we  give this place a 2 star which is being very kind.

Rqn0cmpZLk1h_W0wVPIdiw.text: I'm so sad to have to give Umami a low rating. The reason for this is because it is under new management and we were pretty disappointed to see an entire new menu when we walked in. My boyfriend and I had been there before the management change and we absolutely loved it so when we went back we already knew what we wanted only to find those items were no longer available. It is now an all you can eat and the quality has really gone down. If we hadn't already ordered drinks we would have left based on how different the menu is. It's very off putting to have the same name but have everything different. If you have never been there before, give it a try since you don't have the original to compare it to. I will say they they are attentive and making sure everyone is taken care of so that was good! However, if you have been there before the management change you will be highly disappointed. As I am sure you will see from other reviews. I don't see us coming back.

MQGPhDFi1TGzXSW1Wf06jg.text: Great service and food. Had a great time there and felt like the staff appreciated us being there.

gJ5HWqdWPQ8Yb6oIq_iSIQ.text: Super bummed after leaving this place tonight! One of my best friends and I ate here a week ago and absolutely LOVED our experience! We came in at an off time but still during lunch and was greeted and waited on by the most darling girl! She was so sweet, attentive but not hovering, and just good at her job! The food was fabulously prepared and tasted amazing! We left there SO happy about our experience, with satisfied bellies, and couldn't wait to bring our husbands back! We both raved to them about this new place and were excited to bring them back to try it! Tonight was it. The food tasted great but the husbands were not impressed. They didn't seem to find anything exceptionally special on the menu and what they ordered was just okay. But that wasn't the worst part.....when trying to pay our bill, the staff informed us our card had been declined. It didn't make sense as we were both positive we had the proper funds. Even after checking our accounts and confirming that, our card declined again. After trying a separate card and having that also decline, they realized it was their system and began trying to figure it out. After at least 30 minutes of going back and forth and trying to pay our bill, they gave us 2 options. Either pay cash (which we didn't have), or leave our card number, expiration date, and name with them to run it when the system came back up! Ummmmm no?! You want me to give you my credit card information?! No. Well, with 2 babies (8 mo old with us, 2.5 yr old at home with grandparents) that needed to go to bed, it was already insanely late and this was just taking more time. The manager had already left for the night I guess, and I wasn't going to leave my credit card info. So I had to leave my husband there, rush a crying baby home to put him to bed, send my dad back to the restaurant with cash so he could pay, JUST as the system came back up...of course. All of this trouble and absolutely NOTHING offered from the staff or manager. The manager has supposedly been contacted so it's not like she was unaware. It's not my fault their system is down and they can't accept my payment. Being someone in the business of customer service, I'm VERY frustrated with our experience tonight and my husband has made it EXTREMELY clear, we will not be returning to this establishment. As a brand new business, it doesn't look good on their watch. Sad, but we won't be back anytime soon!

xJctbi7c0NXBxtWb3lhXWQ.text: Good selection for a family with kids who aren't completely sold on sushi.  They loved the chicken teriyaki and vegetables.

lGNFEq3fk30isyKUbzpWlA.text: This is our second time eating here. It's always my wife, my 6 year old daughter and I. The first time we ate here the owner gave us a complimentary bottle of sparkling peach saki which was amazing. The service is perfect and everyone is beyond friendly. This time we ordered a la carte for my daughter and the owner offered for her to eat free off our all you can eat. Granted she doesn't eat much but that's awesome customer service and something you never see at a sushi spot. The chef sent over a bear made out of a orange for my daughter which put a huge smile on all our faces. How can you beat that! Let me comment on the sushi real quick. The best way to put it is it's the exact opposite of what your use to. What I mean is we are use to getting large portions of rice and smaller portions of fish. At Umami it's the exact opposite. Huge portions of fish on small portions of rice. It's dang near nigiri lol. My wife and I had our first date a sushi tachi on centennial and Aliante and that has been our sushi spot for 9 Years. With out a doubt Umami is now our new favorite spot. The sushi is amazing and has the biggest variety by far out of any of the sushi spots we've been to. Great job guys! Customer for life!

O6Fbwdn0LpMCCJ3EERUtsQ.text: The AYCE sushi here was simply great, not to mention the service, cleanliness, ambiance, and price. BuSxx4roOljgr0hK5-blZQ.text: UPDATE December 2017: This sushi place used to be our go to place (see previous 5 star review below). However, it was recently (around October 2017) taken over by new management. The prices are more afordable and you can expect to receive slightly more meat per order. However, the two things that really set the old Umami apart for me was the quality of the fish (and other food) and great service. Both have gone down noticably under new management (therefore the new 2 star review). For this reason I will be finding a new sushi place to frequent.  OLD REVIEW February 2017: If you are looking for a sushi place in the Centennial Hills area this is the place to go, without question. This place takes the spot as one of the best sushi restaurants in Vegas. Every fish that we tasted was incredibly FRESH including the salmon, tuna, yellowtail, and the snapper. Both times that we went here we chose to sit at the sushi bar. Where we enjoyed our very quick one on one service from sushi chef Kim. Kim made various recommendations and came off as very knowledgeable. After our main meal; we chose to try the mochi and macaroons which were great as well! Each of the two times we've been here it was a great date experience in a restaurant with a great atmosphere. You won't find an all you can eat option here, but the food is well priced and after you have tasted the quality of their fish you will understand why they are not giving it away through all you can eat specials.

KDOlchPrh-CA148hgKlsLg.text: I'm still aquiring a taste for sushi but this place is definitely my favorite. You can choose to sit at a table or the sushi bar. If you want recommendations from the sushi chef then this is a great choice. Service is quick, and fairly reasonably priced. The atmosphere is really cool. Definitely recommend for date night or going out with friends. Try the spicy tuna roll!

zXhh6OubJtNBcm0fTRSIPQ.text: By far the best sushi restaurant I have ever found, which is tremendously disappointing since I found this place 2 weeks before moving to Idaho! I feel like most sushi places have a lot of the same ideas going, but this place is able to think outside the box with fresh ingredients. a7NY4tEo2WxhU7jgargAwA.text: I really like this place (minus the constant K-Pop playing in the background). The new menu is a huge improvement, and the food is terrific. There are some Nobu knock-off dishes (yellowtail & jalapeno is just one example) but that's ok. It's nice to get these dishes at less than half the cost of the Strip. VbU0MysygIoIIGdaZ2jutg.text: Umami was a Jewel, now it is like every other mediocre sushi place so disappointed, the new management has ruined what was a great experience, behind the host podium they have put their Togo service station that now clutters the sushi bar. They have also crudely taped paper announcements to the walls. The food used to be really good, today it was terrible the lunch Roll combo served a salad of iceberg lettuce and a couple pieces of spinach and julienne carrot with a squeeze of dressing in the center of it coating one piece of lettuce and saturated with water. The tempura was greasy and miso soup was I don't know what, more like dish water! The spicy tuna roll was mushy and the sushi rice was not seasoned. The old menu was well written and thoughtful for the customer the new menu is just like every other place around nothing special.

W02ladHF8Ta_XZSXNhnejg.text: HOW DOES THIS PLACE HAVE 4.5 STARS??? First they served drinks in cans, the edamame undercooked and the bowl was half full. By this point we were disappointed but stayed hopeful for the sushi. The waiter wandered around the place and gave us the wrong rolls three times before getting ours. Then tried giving our rolls to two other tables before giving them to us. My sushi was average but my boyfriend didn't like his. Randomly we smell a horrible smell, smelled like shit. It just lingered for most of our dinner and made it difficult to eat. Super disappointed to spend $50 on a terrible experience.

0FC7frTtx_goSJYfZgzKTg.text: Tried this place for the first time with 20 of my relatives.  Food was great,  service was excellent and definitely coming back for the AYCE Sushi.

4Z9Fd26XkM3w3pXjjtT8Lg.text: My sister, niece, and I visited this place around 1:30 to 2 and it was not busy at all. There was probably three or four tables occupied including us. The place was clean and spacious with many places to be seated. AYCE lunch price is $21.95 from open to 3PM and AYCE dinner price is $26.95 3PM to close (AS OF APRIL 7th, 2018). Half rolls are an option for their signature and specialty rolls.  --- We ordered the super white tuna nigiri, salmon nigiri, unagi, lemon salmon (half) roll, popcorn lobster (pictured), butter fly (half), Wonder Woman (half), wet dream, Japanese lasagna, baked lobster (pictured), Capt. America, hamachi kama, baked green mussels, edamame, and miso soup.  The top three rolls I recommend everybody to try is the Wonder Woman, Japanese lasagna, and Capt. America. The Wonder Woman roll had shitake mushrooms inside which tasted amazing. Japanese lasagna was perfectly baked and not overdone (pictured). The Capt. America had some spice to it but wasn't too spicy.  I recommend to avoid the wet dream. I've had this roll in other sushi locations and for the most part they follow the same track of tasting good. However, Umami's didn't. The roll tasted sour like they added too much lemon to it. We don't recall the roll having lemon but if it did, they definitely need to lessen the amount on the roll.  For dessert we ordered the coffee and strawberry mochi and an affogato. You are limited to only one dessert off the menu. The desserts we ordered tasted great!  --- The one con about this place is that service is a little slow in my opinion and the tables are weirdly sticky. When eating AYCE sushi, I want to order continuously trying multiple items from their menu. As for the tables, I don't know if the previous customer spilled a drink or something but the table was sticky and it felt gross eating on it. But despite all that, they kept our drinks filled to the rim and our hunger satisfied!

DNPVe5pIo8Ge4u_nbhqpNA.text: We waited 57minutes to be seated, no big deal I thought, food must be worth the wait. Once we sat down, it was another 5-10 minute wait for a waiter, fine by this point I'm starving I just need food. So we ordered the all you can eat. Great. First roll came out in good time, we placed a second order at this time. 30 minutes later we still have not seen our second order.. I almost feel dumb for waiting that long before asking waiter, I figured they are on top of their tables. Needless to say, waiter had no idea what our second order was.. rude. We got our check paid for what we ate and left. All we did was waste our Friday night here, 2 1/2 hours most of it spent waiting. Shame. I will NEVER stray from sushi loca ever again. If you don't mind waiting, I guess their food is good!

ijLXV0fXTDA-GiSHFsCiVg.text: This is a good sushi restaurant close to the locals but there are better to chose from. Only problem is that they are a good drive away. Would totally recommend Umami though, they are quick and pretty damn good.

5XVnGpJu4Sw_VHEZ9UtUkA.text: Food was good. Staff was friendly. I waited a couple minutes at the door while some of the staff sat on chairs chatting. Probably off the clock, but it would look bad to some customers. Overall happy and would go again!

M4Sp3p76l9r8BHuK_bSwMA.text: Came in and noticed that there's no bar seating, they've removed all chairs from the bar and made it all table seating.   Ok, sushi eating can be done at a table but why? Business meeting, or you brought the kids. Ok fine.   So they put boxes and other miscellaneous storage here between the wall and the sushi bar. Kind of unsightly.  We sit in the waiting area and three guys come in and wait too. As we wait, the host comes and seats them before us. Yet we checked in first. OK no big deal. Maybe seating for three was available first than seating for two? Who knows. We wait for another twenty minutes, and I see empty tables.   Then a couple started to leave and on their way out they are compelled to warn us to not eat there.   They said that they waited over 30 minutes for their first order and it was wrong and when the correct food did arrive a chicken teriyaki that it was undercooked. No one wants undercooked chicken.   So we left. This is the second time we've tried Umami and been.... Sadly disapointed.

GqthTTIMhkPh0hAuMXZ3gQ.text: OMG!!!  Delicious!!!  If you haven't tried this place you definitely should.  Highly recommended in my book.  All you can eat sushi for all you adventurous individuals.  This place does not disappoint.  Service fast and attentive while food hot (hot dishes) and fresh!!  Friendly staff.  Upon entering seated sushi chefs greet with a hello simultaneously.  Will be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Umami - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TVPPgl23jrsdVp34fIkNyw.text: There aren't a lot of great sushi spots in the Centennial area, so Umami is definitely my go-to spot when I'm craving sushi. It's a nice place to hang out, have a beer, and enjoy a few sushi rolls. On a recent visit I ordered the Hawaiian roll, the lemon salmon roll, and the "burning your ass" roll. Each roll tasted fresh and had its own distinctive flavor, but I definitely recommend the Hawaiian roll.   The wait staff is kind, knowledgeable, and they make great recommendations. Once they take your order, the food comes out within five minutes. My only complaint is once you make an order your waiter disappears for a little while, and it feels as if they've forgotten you, but their wait staff is so friendly and attentive when they're with you that it's not really a problem.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Penny beer because of yelp? Okay!

0itgP42CL3FZdZGUjF4lmg.text: Atmosphere is fun an casual. Great place for lunch. Price for lunch is $22 a person and completely worth the price. There are eclectic sushi rolls, and appetizers. Same owners of Hwaro. Friendly staff.

LDCqqORE7YSQQs6NheFSfQ.text: We love this restaurant after they changed it to all you can eat sushi. The selections are great and I like it that they don't give you a lot of rice so you don't get fill up fast, very generous with the fish portions. This place is our go to all you can eat

waA7OWN0mS6XzKQ5ayupNQ.text: Omg. First time here tonight. We did the AYCE. Everything was so fresh. Service was unbelievable. Someone always around to serve you. We tried all kinds of rolls and sushi. I think our fav was the Chef #1. But there was so much more. Spicy tuna roll, Shrimp Lover roll, just all so good. Pieces: yellowtail, eel, tuna. Delish. It's our new favorite joint and we will be regulars.

x9ItrM1MoXApIUTNXGzNXw.text: Umami is an AYCE sushi located in North Las Vegas. If you are in this area, this place is so worth your time. I went to Umami after a long day of work. I was pleasantly surprised that they offer variety of alcoholic and non alcoholic beverage for free with Yelp check in. I gave them their first star for this.   We were greeted right away by their wonderful staff. Our waiter was sweet and really helped us navigate through their endless options of nigiri, sushi rolls, and appetizers. The decor of the restaurant is really spot on. Light fixtures and little details on the wall really pleasant. The ambiance was great, with touches of Japanese arts.  We selected a huge order of nigiri from their menu.  They have a section in their menu for nigiri (one order per visit) that is a good deal. There were about 5 items on the menu that was in this category. My favorite out of the five  were uni and oysters.   Also, I was really blown away by the way they execute their nigiri portion. Because I have never had nigiri cut in thin really long slices before. The nigiris also came with very tiny pieces of rice (you get more fish for your order) which is AWESOME.   I would visit umami again. Next time I am bringing my whole family here for an evening of food and fun. Great service, great food, and most importantly, great price! AYCE $27

vePBRQtDWOWOeKfMuCihNw.text: This has to be my favorite all you can eat sushi spot  You are greeted immediately, seated quickly, staff are wonderful and the sushi is amazing

photos.caption: Photo of Umami - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Umami menu

K-zktgNYXpuGCpy-Y0lnDA.text: They are not the same since they got sold Service is mediocre  There is no rhyme or reason how food comes out Which normally is ok but  5 at a table and 3 got all there food and 2 sat waiting that's not right Order appetizer and never got till the end of meal after we asked 3 times

TQMq4u67uoTGFZUpgJqb1Q.text: Assorted sushi, you can do a half order on the all you can eat which is convenient so you can try a ton. Staff was nice

EHJvZxqIhgAYKYSO-w2skw.text: I live down the street from this sushi restaurant and finally decided to stop in and try it. I was pleasantly surprised at the quality they present for an AYCE. I have placed this near the top for my sushi encounters now. The fish was fresh and they don't overload their sushi with a ton of rice so that you can enjoy more fish. If you want to have a nice outing with friends and family and are in the mood for more fish and less rice then you should definitely be at umami.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All you can eat sushi.

TN2xR6O9hTXgVnxSnbPGzw.text: This is it!  After so many prayers, wishes, and animal sacrifices, we finally found a AYCE sushi spot by the house.  Located in the Office Depot plaza right off of the 215 on Durango N. the shorty and I stumbled on this gem while we were out on an adventure to demolish some yummy food.   Interior is a very nice mellow part sporty, part urban feel. Very clean might I say. Plenty of room with i think 3 large tables for those larger parties.  Always greeted and seated when we walk in, with as little as 0 Z-ro wait time. Not because they are bot busy, but because they are on top of turning over the tables.  Customer service is amazing. Fun, funny, knowledgeable, and patient staff. In fact, our first time here, the owner was nice enough to let us sample their dinner menu during lunch. On several occasions the chefs even had themed hats from The Golden Knights night, to a military themed night.  What was ordered:  Pang  Spicy Garlic Edamame  Power up - deep fried eel Shrimp tempura Bake green mussel 2 Salmon Kama Bacon and lobster skewer Bacon asparagus  Towering Sashimi  Sashimi Roll Miso  Tuna Salmon  Yellowtail Garlic salmon Albacore  Super white tuna Mackerel Strada lobster Tobiko Salmon belly  I'm sure I'm missing some stuff, but this is our usual take.  LET ME TELL YOU! They just may have the best rice to protein ratio down in Vegas. 10/90 is usually how we are served. Oh boy! And I love my protein. They have some of the tastiest takes on specialty dishes as well. I'll have to update to name some.   Point blank, definitely worth the try, trip, and that animal sacrifice we made.   We're happy!

qdAxbUkLsWflmBdQ1VZzeA.text: Best sushi in the NW Vegas area!  Another great success by the Hwaro group.  This is by far the best sushi (no just in the AYCE category) in the area.  Took a star off for it being the typical Korean  -styled heavily-sauced AYCE.  I ordered everything with no sauce and they tasted fresh.

mqFDoJCxq1Ck3g-MUANbPQ.text: Wow. Just wow.   The pieces of nigiri that they serve are so big, that you can wrap the fish around the entire portion of rice. The only AYCE place I've been to that gives you such a large amount of fish in comparison to rice. The fish was very fresh tasting and service was really kind.    This will be my new sushi spot, even if they do not have a stamp program (which I'm not sure if they do or not) because you truly get your money's worth with the amount of fish they serve. Many places try to fill you up on rice but not this place. Restaurant was a nice size, not too cramped and service was fast as well.   Prices were comparable to other AYCE sushi restaurants which is nice.   Not a single bad critique based off my first experience and I will be having many more to come.

VEGyUetqmmx8_263z3vqGQ.text: We stopped going here because they never had UNI which is my favorite fish. So tonight they had UNI with a quail egg. They were very attentive and the sushi kept coming. Can't wait to go again. Except I left my sesame oil on our table. :(   We ordered yellowtail but I couldn't figure out which fish was what. The mackerel was outstanding another fish I absolutely Love. My husband eats sushi with nothing added like soy sauce. He's a die hard sushi eater. We will be back very soon. I would like to pay sashimi prices as I get sick from rice. Via Gastric Bypass

otJtGBHPRhHgZz8og29H7g.text: My wife and I usually come to eat on weekdays but seeing as it was father's day, they wanted to treat me at our favorite sushi restaurant. I am absolutely thrilled that there is a quality sushi AYCE restaurant within driving distance from our home. When we got there the restaurant was packed and they told us the wait was going to be about 45 minutes. We've waited before during special occasions so it did not surprise me. We were actually seated earlier than 45 minutes. The wait is not my complaint. What did surprise me was that service was extremely slow. Ordering food and receiving our second and third orders took unusually long. I had to order a few things more than once because it was missed the first time around. The staff looked overwhelmed with the rush. I did notice that our usual servers weren't there. Even the owner of the restaurant had to come help take orders as best as he could. I really hope this was just a one time fluke and that this doesn't become another sushi loca. The three stars instead of 2 is because our experience isn't normally like this.

RE2WYZfr15Cbzq5DVsZftg.text: A little pricey but pretty good overall. We stuck to the sushi menu. We did have a little bit of an issue with them not complying with the avocado allergy we had at the table. But it wasn't a big issue overall because we noticed both times and sent it back. I would return here and enjoyed the experience.

AML0ZskOvO9bHLnszOWFIA.text: Very good. A little high priced considering a few Sushi places that are all you can eat. Not all great but a few are exceptional and a lot cheaper than this. Lobster Ramon is excellent, very spicy but so good. Sushi Rolls great as far as what we ordered. Oysters very small, too small for the price. Sushi, good but not so cold. Raw fish should be cold not room temperature. Staff was great the bus boys are awesome. (Hope the share in the tips because the really take good care of you).! Nice to have this on our side of town and will no doubt be back.

U1Vllixu15P9ijKuUnre7A.text: This is probably the best Japanese restaurant around. From the decor, the friendly staff, to, more importantly, the food, Umami doesn't let you down.  We went to Umami not too long after eating at Morimoto's in MGM and were worried about it not living up to the previous foodgasm, but Umami delivered. What a relief to have great food in Centennial Hills!  Favs: white fish carpaccio, tiger roll, karaage (exceptional), chashu ramen, and so much more.

1QMX23cK8--qs4paE4NRSg.text: Best sushi in NW Vegas.  You can save the 45 min drive and the crowds and have amazing sushi in the NW.  first time here, didn't want to drive far from my house, so yelped ayce sushi.  Saw 41/2 stars and it didn't disappoint. Got almost every piece of nigri and all the no rice rolls.  Amazing, just hard to locate.  It's by BBW. Great price on saki and sushi and fresh quality fish in the NW.

gW9G00Ua76W46F0Q9mbcSg.text: Excellent food, atmosphere, and decor.  Every single dish we ordered was great!  Had the yellowtail hamachi, agedashi tofu, salmon skin hand roll, tempura udon, and short ribs.   Give this place a try!  You won't be disappointed.

bImZ1CmBPGYesj9PbPcM3g.text: I'm giving this place with three stars because the food was really really good but the customer service could've been better. The time that my husband and I went they were not that busy. So like I said the food was great but the customer service could have been a lot better. So if you want good food with okay customer service then this is the place for you.

oaaFiEmWyrLJM5MbTgThwQ.text: First time at this place, I really liked the painting on the main wall and the decorations, the tables were a good size. Our first server however must have been having a bad day, not all of them were cranky, so it was a guess as to who would come to the table with what attitude.. the food was quick, we received all but one of our orders, we received one order that wasn't ours but didn't realize until we'd already tasted it, but it was good, so no harm done. The drinks never went past half empty which is always appreciated. Probably not going to go back but enjoyed the experience.

k2ml9LyvlKz066FxTOb1cA.text: Great service and sushi loved the atmosphere and it was a great overall experience!! The gyoza is delicious and you have to try the spicy salmon roll

gENDlcvOYVupeOUbR5v92g.text: This is our second time here and both times we have be very pleased! The food and the service was excellent! A must try!!

XVkQ25y2xLT9nZbE35gSRw.text: Delicious sushi and appetizers and based on the generally high quality of the food alone, I will certainly be back. So why only three stars? Let's just say I consider this to be a "provisional" grade (or perhaps the better word for it is "probationary"). And the reason for this is the service. It is simply a disaster. Poorly organized, scatterbrained, and just plain misinformed. They repeatedly delivered the neighboring tables' dishes to us, and vice versa. So much so that it became an inside joke between us and the neighboring table. While amusing, It really showed a startling lack of finesse and training on the part of the staff. In a few cases staff were unable to identify a particular dish, yet insisted it was ours. I will return and at such time I will reevaluate this grade.  But for the moment it stands at three stars.

XPd3qrL1xdEg8q2TTFblkA.text: So after hearing all the buzz about this being great I decided to try it out with my mom. Their service, and sushi was great however some rolls took longer than normal. I was told it was because the sushi chef was behind but it wasn't to crazy busy during dinner time. Would defiantly recommend as they don't overcrowd with rice, and everything on the menu was part of AYCE. Will be going back for sure.

ZpGvIMEUQm4jmnmqUwb4Zw.text: I love this place!!! The fish to rice ratio is amazing! The fresh seafood! Even the sushi rice is delicious!  The service is so prompt and on point! Great atmosphere for anyone. I love that this place is not far from home! My fave is the yellowtail yuzu and ikura! All are yum! Come try it out. You will be stuffed but not disappointed!

uHggx2VvAET0LaTBGYI-qg.text: We had been going to Sushi Tachi for years but recently tried Umami and it is so much better. Overall, it's cleaner, nicer atmosphere, much faster service. Umami's food is much better as well. It's so nice to go to a sushi place where the tables aren't super packed together and the decor is well designed. The wall murals are fantastic and modern, rather than outdated Asian art that most places have.  Their rolls are well made, nigiri portions are much larger, and the selection of rolls is much better as well. Loved the New Washington roll, it was just one of many different rolls that I've never seen before elsewhere. This is absolutely our new place and we will be going back again soon!

ApdsBJik33vP0Tuc6MnuZg.text: Hidden gem in Las Vegas. We enjoyed every plate we ordered! Extremely satisfied with the quality for the price we had to pay.

98nmymlXUdpHVtgTTgS_jQ.text: Service was really wonderful. The staff was friendly and our waiter, Caesar, was really kind and engaging. We shared many laughs and made our dinner much more fun. I would go here again !!

p1FHVybtqHi6pA_ERnDrNA.text: Pretty good all you can eat sushi place. The menu is (I believe) the same as sushi neko; which is would make sense since they advertise for sushi neko on their actual menu. In any case, food is good. We particularly liked the seared salmon, unagi, Saba, hamachi. I do wish they had more dishes other than sushi like seared pork belly. The ratio of fish to rice is excellent. The quality of fish is good too. The biggest thing is that it's a good sushi place up north. Service was also good. Go check it out!

osXXTzW5idEkqoj5Rh-Dxw.text: All the good stuff about Japanese food that you love.  Generous pieces of fish on nigiri, fresh uni, fresh wasabi on some dishes like tako wasabi, and FAST and COURTEOUS service. Clean, hip, place with an authentic asian vibe, tucked away in a neighborhood I love. Please keep it up. would love a rewards program if you can.. would love some kids options like a bento box special for the light eaters. There is 50% off the ayce for kids 3-7, but still too expensive when kids hardly eat.  I saw someone bring in mcdonalds for their kid.  Hopefully some more kid friendly options will appear for a restaurant being within the residential community.

9HSwZJ8XIOYSOgOOnYtbWA.text: It was our first time and service was excellent, all the wait staff was super friendly and the food came out super fast. We ordered several of the limited to 1 time orders (nigiri salmon belly, oysters, screaming o) all the nigiri orders come with huge fish portion and very little rice, however the be warned the rolls are ginormous & come with heaping amounts of rice. We found out this was same owner as Sushi Neko in Chinatown which we frequent quite often and the rolls there have much less rice and smaller than here, other than that, the sushi quality was very good, food was served piping hot and tasted delicious. We ordered the udong noodles for our 3 yr old and it was just the perfect amount. We will definitely be back as we are locals, this location is much closer for us.

ciO1D1I2ymfaHADjVr94BA.text: Came in on a whim with the kids. Lot of options for the whole family. Was really really good. New favorite spot

UIxANkI8972rg2T555boAA.text: Wow! What a great little restaurant! The service was phenomenal and all of our roles came out quick fresh and delicious.  Every roll had good flavor that was intense and bold when needed but also very light and refreshing on other rolls.  The only thing that I found strange was when I asked for a cup of coffee she brought me an iced latte. Or at least it seems like a nice latte. I like having a hot cup of coffee after every meal so getting something iced was unexpected.

WZVTa0pCRlV7kMv0Ag5edw.text: I been wanting to try Sakana for years but it's just so far from home, with the same owners buying up Umami I finally got to see what it's all about!  Some yummy AYCE sushi not far from where we live!  No need to trek across town for that raw fish!  The neighborhood seems to like it too, the Date Night wifey & I went was packed with patrons!  Was probably about a 15 minute wait before we got seated.  But once we got seated and greeted by our server, it was on like Donkey Kong!  After an initial 20 minute wait the food starting coming fast & furious!  We ate (and ate and ate):  -Pang -Hamachi Kama -Takoyaki -Burning your Ass -Screaming Orgasm Sashimi -BTS -Chanel -Popcorn Lobster -King of the Lobster -Something Wrong -Salmon Belly -Uni -Mini Miso Ramen -Spider Roll -Jackpot -Hawaiian  So much food in so little time!!  You got an 80 minute time limit, better make good use of it!  But wow - what great eating!  We had just a stack of food on our table...for 2 people!  Gotta say for us the food was on point!  Nice sizes of fish over rice, great ratio!  Good quality too!  Rolls were delicious, as well as the appetizers!  AND Umami does 1/2 rolls too, perfect for sampling a bunch from the menu!  Last time we were there, if you check in with Yelp you can get a small imported beer (I got a Sapporo) or a can of soda for FREE!  Get lit LOL!  Price was good too for a dinner meal - $26.95 a person!  Totally in the realm of great value!  Our service was excellent too, friendly, knowledgeable, & quick to please!  Overall a great meal!  We'll be back Umami!  Probably tonight because it's Date Night!

Photo of Umami - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MBTXZ6_y2QZKfWp5WXLr8Q.text: My experience here seems to be inconsistent.   My visit today was disappointing. The rice was falling apart and seemed stale, maybe from the day before? The usually quick turn around was slow. And I felt like the rolls just weren't the same quality that I've come to expect at this place. Probably because of the rice...but even the cuts of fish were weird and messy.   This is my third visit. The first time was mediocre. Second was great. Third was meh.

oCKrSWLxn5aJcZoChydlEA.text: I have to say, when we started our meal, I was pretty sure they were going to get a two star review.  The four of us all did the all-you-can-eat option. It took 45 minutes to an hour and we each had gotten only one item/order. We had a hard time getting a hold of our waiter, to see what was taking so long or try and get a highchair for my 10-month-old.   When we did get a hold of him, he was surprised that we haven't gotten our food yet. And upon talking to the sushi chefs realized they didn't make a lot of the food because they were out of tuna. So that solves my companions issues, but I don't eat raw fish and had ordered nothing with tuna and still didn't have my food either. We talked to the server morning and realized they had a very busy day and we're also understaffed. Despite the craziness, he was very nice and apologetic. And told us that he could give us the lunch price for all you can eat for our trouble as well as extra desserts.  Eventually the food started coming out more quickly and we found everything to be very delicious. They give great servings of fish and don't overdo the rice.  I was most impressed at the end of our meal by the manager. He thanked us for our patience, and asked what we loved and didn't. He explained that he is the new manager and is making changes to improve the restaurant. He gave us 50% off our entire meal and promised that he would do his best take care of us and give us a great experience at our next visit.   I was really impressed with his professionalism and openness. Despite the evening starting off somewhat challenging, I was very impressed with his management. We are looking forward to going back and watching the place grow and improve!  The only other suggestion I have is to add changing tables to the restrooms!

photos.caption: Photo of Umami - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Umami - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Umami - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WsxTZGCEYsSgu6CKt5TvzA.text: Umami is great if nigiri is your go-to selection at an AYCE sushi place.   I've been here four times and never had bad nigiri. I generally get salmon, tuna, yellowtail, red snappers, white tuna, and cajun albacore. The fish quality is always great and the size is huge as you can see in the photos. Unfortunately, Umami doesn't carry the big, white, creamy scallop. What you get is the chopped up scallop that is very chewy for some reason. The rice is good but short of amazing. I generally get a small bowl of sushi rice all by itself. To me, the rice could use a little more sugar and vinegar. Nevertheless, it was good enough to make the nigiri as a whole a satisfying indulgence.   I am not a fan of rolls in general and Umami doesn't do anything to change that for me. I've only tried their tiger roll and it was not the best I've had before.   The service here is great. The servers checked on us frequently to make sure we always have something to eat. Also, nigiri comes out so fast it's crazy. Absolutely no complaint here.   Overall, Umami is a fantastic place to get you nigiri fix...minus the scallop. :(

photos.caption: Photo of Umami - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nicely sized and fresh nigiri! Loved it.

buYZu5-NwbQBxwQ_zGTVHA.text: When this place first opened it was not AYCE, but I had a friend tell me they changed that so I definitely had to stop in. It wasn't the best sushi place I've been to, but it was good and I'd return.   We went for lunch at 12:00 on a Thursday, only one other table of 2 inside. For rolls we got the popcorn lobster roll was amazing, not what I was expecting at all. The bam bam roll was okay, their screaming orgasm sauce I don't think is as good as other places.   Their baked mussels were not very cheesy but they were very hearty. Tried the shit, of course good. Bulgogi was alright. The cucumber crab salad was okay, it had way too much sauce.   Their nigiri list was pretty extensive, much larger than the place I usually go to. Their nigiri pieces of fish were massive, way bigger than any other place I've been to. It can be a little excessive, but for the price and quality I thought it tasted great.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Popcorn lobster roll

WnwgklSgvThO8hT1UQQIWw.text: When I think of all you can eat sushi, the first thing that comes to mind are trays of sushi that have been sitting for awhile and dried out, or plates and plates of sub-par sushi gliding by via conveyor belt...Umami is definitely NOT that.  You order off their EXTENSIVE menu and everything is fair game.  I hear this place gets packed on weekends so the three of us decided to visit during the week and for early dinner.  There were only a few diners when we got here but by the time we left at around 730, it was full.  My main focus was nigiri and wanted to try as many as I could.  They have over 30 types on their menu so it was hard to decide where to begin.  I'm allergic to shellfish so that did limit me on some, but that still gave me option of around 20.  I skipped some like the tamago and ikura and ordered double of some like the unagi and red snapper.  One thing to keep in mind is a few of the items you can only order once like the salmon belly and uni.  I did try one of the rolls as well, the Bam bam rool which was pretty good.  Some of other non sushi things we tried were the bulgogi appetizer and the hamachi collar, both were really good but the hamachi collar was exceptional.  All of the items were fresh and came out super fast but my favorites by far were the salmon belly, uni, and the unagi, these were really good.  And one thing about the nigiri...the cuts of fish were fairly large and the rice is on the smaller side making the piece of fish look even more huge, pretty impressive visually.   Their motto is "Creating memories, one full belly at a time" and I can assure you, I left full!  The AYCE price at dinner was $26.95 and I have no doubt for the amount and quality of food I had, it would've been  triple that amount at any other decent sushi place.  This is no-brainer come back to spot for me the next time I'm in Vegas.

4XY_paO0R3ntJG7Uuc28Ew.text: This place has a nice scenery. The host/waiter Cesar was very awesome, great personality making our family laugh majority of the night! The food quality was amazing for an all you can eat sushi spot! I was surprised by some items that were available for the all you can eat for example the Uni, which is a delicacy and usually is priced high if purchased alone at other places. The service was great and I definitely will be returning !!!

Adg4DvhJH95JfaS2zcQ2bg.text: I stopped by today for a quick lunch because I haven't been here in months. I was sad to see that they no longer offer bento boxes but it looks like that is due to new management. They are also now all you can eat for all of you who love those kind of sushi places.   I didn't do all you can eat today because I never tend to be hungry enough. I ordered miso, a house salad and a lobster roll that I can't remember the exact name of but it had tempura shrimp and cooked lobster inside with salmon and avocado on the outside. The miso was actually super flavorful which is great because I've had a lot of very bland miso. The house salad was an extremely generous size for only being $1.50 and I enjoyed the dressing they used. The only problem was that they absolutely drenched the salad in dressing so it was a bit soggy towards the end and I didn't finish all of it.   The roll is listed on the menu saying it is an 8 piece but when I got mine it was only 5. I asked the waitress and she told me it is only supposed to be 5 but due to the misprint she quickly got me 3 additional pieces. Honestly I was full after 5 so I can see why they don't normally do the full 8 pieces. The roll was really good and they give a sauce with it that compliments it well. Only complaints would be that the seaweed wrapped around the roll doesn't come apart easily so unless you stuff the whole piece of roll in your mouth it is kind of a struggle to eat.   The servers were really attentive. They checked on me repeatedly but not too much to where it became annoying. My drink was never empty and as soon as I finished something they cleared it away for me. I will definitely have to try out the all you can eat one day when I'm more hungry.

Also, there is a generous discount for those who are military/veterans as well!   Random, but their fries are delicious. We sampled some of T's. Everything else is still on point. The nigiri and rolls were outstanding as usual.

I always order from their Nigiri menu because their fish to rice ratio is ALL fish, like I'm having sashimi. Ooh I love love their Hamachi Kama. It was juicy, delicate and charred to perfection. I know it's hot, but I always have their mini udon as well.   Cezar and AJ (I think that was his name) their customer service skills at it's finest. Most def will return.

3tbCwe7L5dpfwaJaTmIF2g.text: Umami is our go to spot for sushi. We come here almost every weekend but have also tried many other sushi spots in town. Being from Hawaii, we are pretty picky when it comes to sushi and fish. Although the fish at Umami may not be as fresh as we're used to back home, they still make awesome nigiri and their fish is rarely fishy. We usually always stick to the nigiri as my wife and I love fish. Let me tell you, their fish to rice ratio is da best!!! They always give a huge piece of fish and a small amount of rice!   A big downfall is their service, it's always a hit or miss every time we dine here. Sometimes the service is fast and on point, while other times you may be forgotten and need to continuously flag down servers to either take your next order or refill your waters. I will say though we've had more positive experiences than bad ones. I want to give a huge shoutout to Cezar, because every time he has been our server he's always been very friendly and provided excellent service!   Overall, despite the inconsistent service this is a great sushi spot especially for nigiri!

IUDlq8d_dn6DjHHcEVZRBQ.text: First timer and EVERYTHING was so good. Will definitely be back. Quick and friendly service. They have a big variety of rolls. Loved that u can anything off the menu for the all you can eat. Most other places limit you. Will for sure recommend this place to friends!

cnr_nGpUrClFC-0YpWwFPQ.text: This is one of our favorite sushi spots in town. The fish to rice ratio is one of the best (see photos). Great selection of rolls, nigiri, appetizers, and "no rice rolls".   The recently started doing call ahead, which is a must if you're going with a larger party during the weekend.   If you're in the Northwest area, this is a must try!

fG4rkd_ayvKJrR0zd3O3Dg.text: I'm going to have to update my review and in a good way! We tried one more time and we were pleasantly surprised at the changes! We noticed the menu was different and I believe even the interior was changed. We walked in very nervous due to having such a bad experience last time.   First off the the nigiri was absolutely phenomenal, it was like eating at sushi neko or sakana all over again. I love nigiri and everything that we tried was amazing! The appetizers we were delighted with it all. My favorite has to be the fried rice. Just be prepared because it is a lot of rice they give you in the fried rice! The beef in the fried rice even tastes quality. Where I was really nervous was my Vegas roll. The yum yum sauce was anything but before. It tasted like sour mayo. When I got it i was shocked it was absolutely delicious! Even the yum yum sauce was good.  Overall I'm glad everything was up to par with the other sister properties because this is our new favorite place in vegas to get sushi. Keep it going guys!

1qkv0JWzBI3_oGIK6Dqm6g.text: If you check out my other reviews, you will see that I love sushi! I have eaten sushi all over the country, and this is definitely one of the best AYCE sushi restaurants at which I have ever dined. The fish is fresh, the variety is impressive, and the service has been truly excellent. (One server  I will call her "B", is not good. We will make sure that we do not sit in her section ever again, but everyone else has been really, really good.)  I am often disappointed in the quality of the sushi at the AYCE places. This is an exception. Yum! And it is very reasonably priced- I think that dinner is $27 or $28 a person for dinner.

yh5PoUStacoyV2XD0DV2Mw.text: Really disappointed because the rating and reviews made me think we we would a good meal.  We did not have a good meal. Good service but the food was not good. They riced us with every roll we ordered and the rice did not taste fresh, it tasted like it should have been used for fried rice and not for sushi.  We will not be back.

j1bieCE9CqmcYOfI374KtA.text: The biggest plus with this AYCE sushi place is the rice to fish ratio, it's the least amount of rice I've ever experienced.  It's hearkens back to the now closed Sushi Factory.  The best sushi to get is hands down the salmon belly, extremely fatty and rich, like butter.  The other sushi is pretty much standard, uni, ahi, and salmon sushi are all up to par.  The sushi is expertly cut, very clean and thin.  Service is quick and friendly with consistent checks on your table for more orders.  The only negative thing I have to say is the rice is a bit hard.. but since they don't give as much, doesn't quite matter as much.  Recommended even when you have to drive a bit farther from the Strip.

t5Ba32YNZPT4Fv6o5SS2YA.text: I originally was suppose to go to Yama Sushi for lunch today but plans changed and I ended up going to Umami with my mom.  I told her that this place was recommended on this side of town and since it's so close to our house, we might as well give it a go so we don't have to troop down to Chinatown for AYCE sushi.   We got there right before noon and there was only 2 other tables.  We got the female server and she just didn't seem like she wanted to be at work.  She walked around like she regretted not calling out from work today.  With that being said, service was not good.  It took a long time after our appetizers to arrive and for the server to come back to our table to take our entree orders.  We did AYCE so we didn't want to rush but we also didn't want to wait forever to be able to order.  The server also forgot some items we wanted and even my hot tea.  The bus boy was on it, running food and refilling water cups.  More staff clocked as we were finishing up our meal and they helped us with dessert and our check.  The manager was running around but he didn't engage with any of the tables.    We were able to get the last 2 hamachi kamas so we were happy about that.  The power up appetizer  was surprisedly good.  It was pieces of deep fried eel.  It was super tender and very flavorful.  I could eat that all day!  The takoyaki was disappointing.  It was undercooked and doughy.    My mom was really impressed with the sushi bcs they gave hardly any rice and the pieces of fish were huge.  The salmon was a bit off bcs the last piece I had was super fishy and left a bad aftertaste.    We tried to order the poke salad but was told that it was only for dinner although it was not marked.  The server also didn't even try to upsell us to the dinner menu either.    For dessert, my mom had the affagato and they do it just like Hwaro where they put corn flakes on top for texture.  My mom likes that.  I got the red bean ice cream and for some reason it was sour!  It was so weird.  It was like they used bad milk to make the ice cream.  I don't know if they made it themselves or brought it from a third company but it was horrible!    Also the tables were sticky.  Not like there's something on it right now sticky, but the they've wiped but really needs to get bleached kind of sticky.  It was kinda gross.  I used the plastic menu as a table mat.    There were big screen TVs playing college basketball all the while playing k pop.    I'm not very fond of the place... especially with service.  Not sure if I'll be back.

jAduGtIg35JCJxdykS8bFQ.text: This place is amazing! Really high quality sushi, great staff, good drinks, and better steak than I've had on the strip.

WWFUVGR704OYffgAHU6K7g.text: Finally tried this Sushi joint that is still fairly new to the Centennial area. Prices and portions weren't bad. Modern decor. Waiter was great! I couldn't give all 5 stars because I could get all you can eat sushi down the street for approximately the same price give or take a few dollars. However they do have ramen that I did not try. I would go back to try that eventually. If you don't eat enough sushi to pay he all you can eat price. I would definitely check this place out.

-yRYzVt3eg50b0U-dijXQA.text: A new favorite Sushi place in the NW. Try the number 5. See Benjamin. Great sushi chef. He makes sushi an art as it should be. A+ presentation.   Good atmosphere.

ZUKCv9dMC1l1ztcuh1cOIw.text: So good! The service was great, and the food came really fast. Definitely will be going back!!!

gt68BvpyoSsfkx83o3Qo3Q.text: Thrilled we now have Umami as a restaurant choice.   We have been there several times.  We have had the Raman bowls which are filling and excellent.  The specialty roles are well worth the price, as the fish is always fresh.  The garlic edamame was very good..it had some kick.  I've had both the cucumber salad and house salad both great for inexpensive price.   They offer a wide selection of food choices, including sushi, regular dinner choices, teriyaki choices, ramen dishes.  The prices range from low to high depending on the dish.   This is not a fast food restaurant,  this is better dining. They have a few "BIG" booths for larger parties, which is nice if a lot of people share sushi dishes.    I recommend this restaurant, the service and food is consistently great. My husband has degrees in culinary arts (chef), he's pretty picky.  He applauds this restaurant.  Do try some of the more expensive sushi specialty dishes,  they are worth the money.

Z4Eh9a2FIeTPr3zC-3Zr5g.text: Walked in for a to go order and after 3 minutes walked back out. Delay in service though place empty. Started to order and the guy had no idea - said menu changed within the last week. Couldn't even name the equivalents when read him the ingredients.

xpSV35LntdUH7iwiUZkjrQ.text: The sushi is top notch, fresh, authentic and delicious. The service was great, attentive and friendly with a through knowledge of the menu. The prices are a bargain for a restaurant of this caliber. We are so glad to have a restaurant this good in our neighboorhood.

m2jNEBJj1rXw07P4rGafsw.text: Definitely a must try restaurant. We have been enjoying Umami for over a year and the food has been consistent throughout. They have a great environment and top notch service. The staff know us by name and by our usual order and that's hard to find hear days. Give them an opportunity to show what they do best.

nMyKR8KzEyLZR-r8ZqJCQA.text: New Management / ownership the place has changed I lost my favorite Japanese restaurant :-( now it is all you can eat sushi (mostly rice) and it is really not good.

BRMgl0pLaepvKwZwwGuEYQ.text: Just moved to the area and tried the top rated sushi joint near us. Tempura tasted like it has been sitting out for hours. Batter was more chewy than crunchy. Soda by the can. Fish didn't really pop out to me as fresh or cold. All in all this place was just ok. I will be looking around for other sushi options. Service was good.

Ak3IkjAey_WPawvmEcnPDQ.text: Been here twice now. Two different experiences... both were great. The sushi here is amazing and everything is reasonably priced except maybe the drinks...they are a bit on the pricy side. Had the ramen and that is something that will keep me coming back for. What I will always order here is that strawberry champagne cake. It honestly is so worth it. I bring my children with me and I never have any problems my daughter eats some steamed rice and salad and shes always happy. I'll be back for more!

e-g_60SNzDZ7WoT7yWnx3w.text: Hesitant to post anything but a 5 star review because I really do want to see them succeed, we need more variety in the area. Really can't beat the ramen combo that comes with a salad and a roll for $12. The rolls were good, according to my son and husband. They had the miso and shoyu ramen and said they were just ok, we've had much better in town. My major disappointment was that they don't have any vegetarian or poultry based ramen, it's all pork belly. So the other kids and I had the teriyaki chicken and cucumber rolls. Teriyaki was ok, cucumber rolls were good. The service was very friendly. Based on the food alone, I would have probably given it 3 stars but bumped it to 4, hoping people check them out for themselves.

KD7BMTyr3BGAmDNXDRKVvQ.text: Best I have found in NW Las Vegas!  i was spoiled with San Fernando Valley sushi, and have been so disappointed with local faire.  Umami has great atmosphere, excellent quality and the sushi presentation is top notch! We will be back very soon!

m-C_EE4v4CsPGb1_Hc_JlA.text: We went for the 1st time last night. Really enjoyed their food. My husband had some sushi(escolar, pacific tuna) pieces (really fresh) and the Carson Roll. I had the Shrimp Tempura Ramen and the garlic edamame. Will definitely go again, looking forward to trying something different!

iiLL_4WhrsF10dh8tetsJg.text: Well we have seen this place on Yelp last night. Looking at all the pictures and reviews. So today we go in and we always start with salmon sushi. Well very disappointed!! The smallest pieces of fish and not the best cut! Like no marbling at all. So we say like other places out here don't have good sushi. So we order a few rolls.  They were ok but for the price it's not worth it! $83 for two people and were at Arby's now filling up! Epic fail!!

Aiq4QzXCJfJCZLCyZjiW-A.text: Found my new favorite sushi restaurant! The rolls were really well put together. The Red Bull roll was delicious! Great service too.

9r4sV28fKwSrDVUaMC4ZFA.text: We got both types of the ramen and loved them. I'd recommend Umami over Monta even, and all they do is ramen. I have no idea why someone would say the ramen was bland.

KB0U22CZIFdtq3O8NRWIQA.text: I sat at the sushi bar. The staff is incredibly nice and the service was great. The sashimi salad was amazing. I wish they had a cocktail menu though. There list of sushi rolls however is great, it was really hard deciding on which one to try first. I can't wait to come back and try some more.

rKqZncLRQjoME17l5RH_Yw.text: Lobster Ramen was very nice the only issue was the actual lobster was tough to eat. Over cooked just a little. Everything else was very good and the kid's loved the teriyaki chicken...

Y-elZk1BVFJt-4zhMWHHRw.text: First visit.  Definitely worth coming back.  Great dining atmosphere. Dining room has awesome Samurai mural.  Must try their yummy Dancing Eel roll and OMG 3 roll. Can't wait to try other menu items. Staff attentive. Prices reasonable.

FoSg9We2EAlbpimPzryfQw.text: For sure the best sushi place in town we have been to many, but Umami is by far excellent the chef are amazing the food speaks for its self and the presentations are AMAZING! The servers are so polite and helpful! And a great selection of Sake! A must try in Vegas 5 stars all around!

V_20xcBnufDU51ZKccVTCQ.text: I'm not a big fan of this place. If yoi ask me. For exame If you ask for vegetable fried rice. You just get vegies, there was like NO RICE. The Sushi was okay but I would go to another sushi place to get sushi. I tried other things and they always add more than you ask for. So I literally only ordered PLAIN fried rice because everything else i had to send back. Just 2 of the waitresses  had no emotion and was a bit rude, they walked by and I smilead and they looked at me and walked away and didn't even smile back. They were the only ladies working on Sunday 3/11/18 at 9:00. please have a talk. Things to focus on...  * More emotion to customers at least a smile * Stop going over board if someone orders white rice don't add a bunch of sauce. *Better service.  * Chill out on the sauce to stiff!

xrmQf43GfKJvDjEZnhgE3Q.text: I've eaten great noodles at Monta and Sora in Chinatown but nothing they offer can compare to the lobster ramen I indulged at Umami. The spicy miso broth the lobster and other seafood in the ramen comes with is not for the faint of heart but hands down the best damn ramen I've had period. The lobster tail was cooked perfectly and the noodles were on point. Seconds? Yes please!

NB440GPcqZwkTTnFWOttmA.text: This place is amazing! It used to be my favorite ramen place, but now they only serve sushi and it's my new favorite sushi place. The sushi is super fresh and they serve generous portions of quality fish. The service is great too. There's a nice special they have of $1 large sake with all you can eat sushi. I've been here several times and I've always left very happy. Highly recommended!

u4mOyYkQc48-aqrU4HpM9g.text: Been wanting to try this place for a while and stopped in for lunch today. Got there at 11am and we were the first people there. Me and my wife got a rainbow roll, tiger roll, dragon crunch, and the pink lady. All of the rolls we're amazing. After reading all the good reviews glad we stopped in.

jKaZXqxvXyW8cilKlw4YtA.text: Definitely the best sushi bar this side of town.  That being said, I wish they were a bit more traditional with their cuts.  Everything seems to be cut much thicker than it should be, notably their chashu and their sashimi.  I would much prefer having thinner slices and more pieces.

NE9hgNiYL5YZmFx_2UIxBQ.text: Always looking to support a new local business...been waiting to see what this place would offer for some time...sadly I could have waited a little longer.   I ordered the tonkotus Ramen w/ mini roll app, sushi salad and karaagi chicken.  Sushi salad...3oz fish and 1lb. of lettuce..no thank you  Karaagi was good....but..shouldn't the appetizer come before the ramen?...which is overloaded with shaved garlic...sad to say...only Ramen I've never finished...  The sushi is A La Carte....the roll was ok...rice was good in the roll...though...price point on the rolls was high....I see this place becoming another AYCE within 4 months

YKNRDUfVcEJZH19ulQN2vw.text: Noticed this spot a week ago i am glad i went back. The fish was so fresh and the service was excellent! It is worth the drive.

LRU8Q31Bu1HZruyMRIPTIA.text: 5 stars for decor, service, ambience.  4 1/2 for the food.   Not 100% blown away,  but it was pretty damn good and another good restaurant for Centennial Hills.   As well,  you don't feel rushed to order here,  as I usually do in the other sushi restaurants nearby. The selection for sushi isn't as tremendous as you'd find,  but this place didn't offer AYCE either, which I like,  cuz I don't feel like I need to eat 4 huge servings to make it worth it.   Nonetheless, the sushi was fresh, plated nicely and tasty.  My -1/2 comes only because the Japanese Lasagna came with aLOT of mayo sauce not in the description and tonight no Strawberry Champagne Cake everyone else is raving about.  Had the Affogato and that was good vanilla ice cream with coffee poured on top.   Tasty.  Definitely coming back!! (Table next to us ordered the ramen and that looked sooooooo good!!!)

bDRQNNWW1UaYOLcuCD6OyA.text: This place is a hidden gem that provides great all you can eat and fantastic service.

kI4yoe9bjThkIDk_4INxCQ.text: Delicious! I absolutely love this place. The atmosphere is really good. Big screen tv which made it a great place to watch the basketball games. Menu has changed since the picture posted on the yelp review. I was disappointed to see that they didn't have a roll I wanted. However, everything my friends and I ordered was delicious. Really fresh fish and very flavorful sauces. I will definitely come back here again. Staff is friendly, restaurant is clean, and food is great.

amcvIAAHvHSTP3_7Dj27MA.text: First time I excused the slow service. Second time after being open a month I do not. We've been here 20 minutes and no drink/no food. Regardless of how the food is, customer service is required for 5 star.  Edit** the service can use work as previously stated, but the food was amazing. I prefer food quality over service any day.  I'll keep coming back and recommend this.

g4w0gnNi8Lt07DR-Bgf4aQ.text: Great sushi rolls, and the lobster ramens real good too. Didn't really wow me to get five stars but pretty solid. Will be back.
