JNK8nDT_5c_39Zw5vnqDig.text: Went to Umami last night with my sister. Was our favorite place until last night when we quickly realized they had now become an AYCE place. FLAVORLESS and poor quality fish, all made ahead. We were so sad. None of the old Ramen dishes are there or original "designer" rolls that made them stand out. Original staff gone! The gem we had found now blends in with the rest. Back to Yummy Sushi on Cheyenne and Tenaya we go. At least the fish was fresh. It was just a long drive. Please please Umami, go back to the way it was! You were the best! Were being the key word. Last night was awful!

ThVLgK2EVKVg0XCfj1zwcA.text: I really love this place! Unfortunately, their service was aweful on a Friday night. The waitress never came by to check on us, we waited forever for our food. This place is sooo good but best when not busy. Friday nightmare.

1UYuQbVVO7KQuIbNDIhKjQ.text: Sushi was delicious and the staff absolutely lovely. Best road trip stop we could have made for a late dinner!

QcWKVWLwNC-C_VsS6ZPlxA.text: Great sushi AYCE was going to near by place but not anymore this place is way better. Service and food

jexceT4vHP0yetvsMpPQWw.text: Well, this used to be our favorite sushi restaurant. The best that I can figure, they sold the restaurant. I can't say how disappointed we were with the change. It used to be such good quality and service that we wouldn't bat an eye about paying at least a $100 for 2 people. So we figured we would give it a chance but were hesitant because of the "all you can eat" option, which is never a good sign. Now we're still paying the price 3 hours later. well the search for a new sushi restaurant begins. Such a bummer!

MQDB-aR5BjFk55K4jZOeww.text: This is the best sushi I've had in Vegas, and I've been here for almost 2 years. The lemon salmon roll is my favorite. The "pang" appetizer was also really good. Honestly, we got a lot of food and it was all fantastic. Service was fast and very friendly. I'm just upset that I didn't start going here sooner!

x_T09rzC1rKV2HZxMFuBRQ.text: Really good! The atmosphere is really nice and the waiters were all super great. They have the same menu as Neko Sushi. We ordered lisa lisa, popcorn lobster roll, spicy crab, and a Philadelphia roll.

vUHtoxYhfQNDkvTchqR-KA.text: So my Husband and i came here a couple weeks ago (kinda late night) food was awesome and so was the service. So we decided to come back for our anniversary dinner tonight. Extremely disappointing service tonight. I felt like our waitress forgot about us. I only had one glass of water it sat empty for most of our dinner. My husband ordered all you can eat sushi and it took so long for him to get his rolls he could only eat 4. Which just nearly made the all you can eat price worth it. The other waitress who filled my husbands iced green tea was rude no eye contact and acted like we were an inconvenience to her time. Finally when it was time to leave i asked 3 different people for our check before i actually received it and then our original waitress who we saw maybe twice since we sat down came back asking if we wanted desert. All in all for an anniversary dinner we could have go to a sushi restaurant we love and always get great service at. Won't be coming back.

VdJOWloTPGqya0BQFWPl8A.text: Service was lacking, especially from the server.  The bussers were the only ones who looked like they were hustling.   The sushi my husband ordered was very thinly sliced.   I had a roll with no rice. It was wrapped in cucumber.   It would have been fine if it was wrapped once, but the cucumber was wrapped twice and was so thick, the roll lost all of its flavor.  We also ordered the vegetable tempura.  They barely gave us any dipping sauce to go with it.  I asked for another side of it from the busser.  How can I dip the veggies in a 1/4" of sauce?  Definitely never going back here.  Trying to find a new sushi spot in the NW but this is not going to be it.

aTLGI4t-pmgLIhHLKJTLTA.text: This place is awesome! Food was great. People are extremely nice and the service was impeccable. Sushi was fresh and all the rolls tasted delicious. I recommend the number 5.

tOvk4uGLBMd_TL5lPPnEfg.text: Best SUSHI I have had in Vegas. All you can eat is a great deal. AYCE menu is very diverse. Fish is very fresh. Great service. Fun atmosphere.

GO1Ez-Wk0z42azwyAMkinw.text: This place is delicious!! Very knowledgeable staff/chef and super friendly!! Our sushi came out in a timely manner and it was so good! My wife had the crunch dragon roll and the rainbow roll-she loved both. I had the Vegas roll and the superman burrito; plenty to fill up both of us!! We'll be back!

O_adGBzwmhsHraLd1dPEQA.text: So I'm a sushi guy....The plates are exquisite. Sashimi were exceptional cuts. My wife hates sushi and thoroughly enjoyed the teriyaki chicken. I recommend the poki appetizer. The pickled ginger was fresh tasting as well. You won't be disappointed.

ThIMxLVK-uZbr06bN434iA.text: We stumbled upon this gem last night. We enjoyed the Carson roll, very fresh and delicious. Main course was the Shrimp Tempura Udon and my hubby had the Lobster Ramen. They were both yummy. The ramen was spicy and comforting. We ended with sparkling blueberry saki. We will be returning! Staff, music, atmosphere was a chill.

_e6Yz8Gr4g1SPqPUwgGdsA.text: I came here with friends tonight and everything was great! The food was very flavorful and the service was awesome! Darin was our server and he was very nice even though he served us at 10 until closing since we decided to eat very late (I know how frustrating it is to serve someone who comes in 30 minutes before close). We will be returning--during normal business hours next time I promise!

Up39XO3FyIF4fLQkhaOy_Q.text: We ordered like 7 rolls and 3 appetizers. EVERYTHING was good & love the staff.  Atmosphere is nice, relaxing, and modern.  P.s. Get crunch dragon roll & jalapeno bombs.

tPA2iHqgiA7-ICLDv6fp-A.text: The best Sushi ever!   I have had Sushi almost everywhere except Japan and this is the best Sushi that I have ever had.  The decor is fabulous, the service is exceptional, the presentation is amazing and the Sushi is heavenly!     If you like baked rolls you will quickly discover that every baked roll you have ever had in your past was wrong and these baked rolls are just right right right.  If you like Japanese Lasagna order the Vegas roll instead... this is a detour in the right direction!  The Full Moon proves that not every roll has to be heavy to have incredible flavor.    Have I mentioned the Pink Lady yet???  OMG!  Refreshing, sassy & delicious!!  Garlic Tuna??? ooooohhhhh ya!  Make sure Tracy is your server, order the Jalapeno Bomb appetizer (not too spicy) and be prepared to lick the plate while you wait for the Chef to amaze you!  And the Sake.......  oh mann!!!!!  Umami.... the fifth taste.....   Yes please!

Xi4w1BOHNRFJCbvAFwa7LA.text: Umami is Umazing! Great ambiance, attentive service and delicious food! The screaming O and mushroom toban are my new favs! If you are a sushi fan give this place a try!

nkeNRk8rI40nqdnqJYUWmQ.text: Took way way to long to make sushi and us in a tiny table 2 people don't fit in food was high priced and just ok

VAghTcTNUXWWHEnCuXYlsw.text: Tried this last night with my husband for a date night. Loved the artwork and deco inside. The food was amazing! Everything I tried I loved. My favorite was the screaming o with seared tuna! Definitely coming back for more.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PTCzpIuO_KvduPCI45DSjg.text: Great food!  My wife and I wanted a little snack so we shared the Shoyu Ramen lunch combo with spicy tuna roll and cucumber salad. The food was delicious!  We're so happy that they opened up right down the street from us. We'll definitely be regulars here.

lH9lJv1wD-ZwpZLBQaiTjQ.text: Great sushi place in Centennial Hills! One of our favorite family spots to have sushi, ramen and teriyaki chicken. Great atmosphere and super friendly staff. The garlic edamame is a must to try.

BMUfZKUiWwtymGqA0iRkLg.text: Pretty good place. They have a small menu but it's pretty delicious, especially for those who can't decide between ramen or sushi. Looking forward to trying other menu options

DqV5NBPyiYOInifQ0vGZWA.text: So good!!!  Definitely coming back to this place.  Service was very attentive.  And the salmon avocado roll was amazingly fresh.

QuB2EE7HTv3gYo1GsohP8g.text: Great service! Super friendly! The staff was incredible and the food was AMAZING!!! If you love sushi give this place a try.

u8tbcTi3OoKvdkXt651nWA.text: We have been going to Sen of Japan for quite some time and thought we had found the best sushi in town... and then we decided to give Umami a try based on Yelp reviews. Not only were we NOT disappointed, but this is, by far, THE BEST SUSHI we've ever had. And not just in Las Vegas, but anywhere! The sushi is so fresh that it practically melts in your mouth. The pieces were so big and thick. The spicy salmon roll was not typical at all. The pieces of salmon were diced, almost like a Poke. And the Carson roll! Soft shell crab, scallop, tuna, avocado and cucumber with a giant piece of salmon on top. A must have! We went on Wednesday and going again tonight, 2 days later. Our server, Nina, was sweet and extremely efficient.   And did I mention the price?? So reasonable it's crazy. If you love sushi, you owe it to yourself to try Umami. But wait, never mind, don't! I don't want to have to fight the crowds

_jGfW0F0P-5wt_EPfISSXg.text: Lobster ramen was tasty. Expensive but worth it due to the full lobster tail and seafood in it. Crab leg  was tasty (says the hubby) but I couldn't get over the price for ONE leg ($16). Garlic edemame and Gyoza was good too.

TcWRYdJSfIxcCOt65Gb4SA.text: Just had a quick dinner.  Atmosphere is almost like a sports bar (without the noise) serving Japanese food.  Food maybe towards fusion but it was good.  Will be back to try other plates.  Lighting is an issue if you're a senior citizen (like me) as you cannot read the menu unless you make sure you're seated under direct lighting.  Yes, it is on the dimmer side because of the big screen TVs and the projector.  Pricing is typical of suburban Vegas as I've experienced for the last week as a new resident from LA.  Plenty of parking and among other fine dining in this northwest area.  Looks like this area is the new place to frequent and I can see why.

jpARKDpmldh_CabqZPdYXQ.text: My meal was good- very fresh fish. However, The star of the show was the garlic edamame. SO good! Prices were reasonable and service was exceptional. My drink never went empty and got on and out fast!

yLjybKYDirhr6_OuvbDv_g.text: Delicious sushi and teriyaki chicken I think my overall favorite is the Pink Lady sushi ! I have only been able to order out and there times are perfect for pick up always 15-20mins. Would love to dine in, but maybe when my daughters a little older

_ot_vuIqaMyY0kwOsczslw.text: Super happy there is a good ramen place right down the street from where we live. Not only that, but the food is awesome here!

q2-p3whhlEYZjipPKut63A.text: New management do not see old photos. These rolls are gone!! This is an update to my first review. When this place opened almost a year ago it was great!! Selection of sushi and their Champaign cake was fantastic.  Under new management and things are the same.  Seems as if they are focusing on all you can eat and the roles mainly focus on spicy tuna and cream cheese.  Our server was horrible! So fast, like she was busy with other tables and didn't want to wait while we glanced for a sec at the menu, before she walked away. Clearing our dishes before we are even done. Sorry to say, if it's not broken, DONT FIX IT.   Missing the cake btw. Boo to new management and taking so many good rolls away.   First timers and all I can say is great local sushi place. Their atmosphere is so modern, love the open feel and cleanliness.   Small inside so make sure you come early but we had zero problem getting in.   Our server was Stephanie (very polite and attentive) much appreciated.   Music is very upbeat and they have three Tv's.   Everyone is just so friendly! All the food we had I have zero complaints. Made fresh. NOT fishy and made perfect compared to other sushi places near by.  Thanks again for a great first impression.

-3Q6MTUuvxvJAqey0bs5Og.text: Umami is our (bestie and I) new favorite sushi spot! The staff are friendly and constantly checking on you. The menu choices are abundant and flavors are spot on! It's a nice atmosphere and very clean. The AYCE price is comparable to other sushi places but Umami has won us over! We'll be back!

4PS5Lg_idMoLwmmk_Y_rug.text: The atmosphere is decent but my table was super sticky/tacky. I don't think the restaurant is the same as when it first opened. I received 2 laminated menus. One was for AYCE sushi stuff and a smaller one with a few bento box combos, ramens, and udons. Nothing looked really good so I played it safe with a shrimp tempura udon. The order came out with tons of rough chopped and chunked green onions when I asked for none. After I painstaking took them out, there were 2 sad tempura shrimp, 1 slice of fish cake, and a piece of fried tofu cut in half. The broth was typical udon you get from mixing water and the udon concentrate. The udon was cooked okay but had a lot of broken pieces like on the bottom of a package. There wasn't a lot of udon either. I'm rarely on this side of town and I'm rarely eating alone but I had a few hours to kill and wanted to try this place because it was newer and I used to live on this side of town when there weren't a lot of restaurants. My server clearly saw me picking out all the green onions and she even repeated no green onions when I ordered, but she never said a word after. I paid my $11 plus tip and I'll be trying a different place next time.

h_G8gw0JhMTXjeVJm-Qz3w.text: Popped in on a Thursday afternoon. Cool atmosphere. Industrial chic style. We sat at the bar. There was only 1 other person in the restaurant. Service was excellent. Food was excellent. 1. Had jalapeno sushi appetizer. Hot spicy fresh yellow tail with ponzu. 2. California roll was very tasty and again very fresh. 3. Rainbow roll. Colorful presentation. Salmon was top shelf. Avocado was bright green and very fresh and crisp. 4. Shrimp ebi sushi. Largest shrimp I've ever gotten at a sushi bar. Again fresh and delicious. 5. Amberjack sushi. Nice flavor with a truffle sauce. Wasabi buried under the fish. Yum. 6. Yellowtail and salmon salad that was free compliments of the chef. Had a tangy mayo tossed in with roi on top. Was very good. 7. Spicy tuna roll. Perfectly flavored and had the nice red color to it.  We will come again.

0Y6nOV7kEzJmNGI6-o9eWg.text: So glad to have found this place while searching for healthy lunch places after soccer game.  Not your typical strip mall restaurant - we had top notch food  with amazing service in a fabulous space.  There were great lunch options:  my husband and I had the sashimi bowl - super fresh, generous cuts with gorgeous presentation (see pic).  Loved the addition of pickled veggies which gave a satisfying crunch alternative to the fish and co trading briny flavor.  One son had Unagi Don Bowl - big portion of rice & eel which he said was the best dish he's ever had!  The other boy had a mixture of rolls -- all fantastic.    Wish we were staying closer, would have gone bsbk for dinner!

fFVHicH-OMSUI5Vhk9rNPQ.text: Loved this place! Atmosphere was nice and had a very modern look to it with their decor. We sat at the sushi bar and the sushi chef were very nice and interactive. The staff was also very welcoming and attentive. The pricing was definitely not bad compared to other places. Pretty reasonable we went for dinner and the bill was better than expected. I also saw that they have a lunch option for $12 that includes ramen, a sushi roll and salad.  My husband and I had the Screaming O appetizer (seared tuna w/radish ponzu yum yum), Lobster Ramen, Red Bull Roll (soft shell crab, spicy crab,  escolar, avocado, jalapeno, cicumber) and Strawberry Champagne Cake. All were really great choices. Food was amazing. Will be coming back!

uAOP_4NcnBVWWDZbeX1GsQ.text: Went their this weekend, best I have had since moving here (5 years) fish cuts are large and quality was superb!  This is my new go to place!

cs6axAQPDL8KZOziaYn2lA.text: I have to say this is probably one of the best sushi spots in town. I just recently started coming here, and it's probably one of the nicest places I've been. The servers were super nice, and David and Marcelo made my experience amazing. The servers are nice to talk to and they know what the menu consists of, even though they have a ton of menu items to choose from. I enjoyed Marcelo's presence especially, he would crack jokes from time to time and make our ordering experience special. As the food came out, it was fresh and you could tell that it was made carefully from the hands of a sushi chef. If you're looking for a good roll, I would suggest the Lemon Salmon Roll or the Salmon-holic!! I'm addicted to salmon so those were my go-to's throughout the meal. If you wanted to choose a sushi spot that's not too busy and want a super enjoyable experience, go to Umami!! Also ask for Marcelo as your server for the best experience.

nKHWv0YtSu4pumRiFjM1fQ.text: This place is super super good! Love the atmosphere and service is outstanding (waiter Ceazar is the best) but even better than that is the sushi! So fresh and they have big servings of fresh fish on the Nigiri with little rice! Strongly recommend!

vtFTULKchSFYN_LgNes9bA.text: Food is good. Place is clean, friendly staff. I'm able to take my children and family and it's not that crazy loud so they stay calm during dinner

SD6cfAZrRHKHYqH5ueyKtw.text: The food and service were excellent!! This place has done a complete 180 since we last went there before it was taken over by new management. The interior remodel is definitely an improvement. The wait staff was extremely attentive, and the food quality has definitely been upgraded as well. Well worth the 2nd chance after a bad experience there 8 months ago.

4dhWtuCa6_P3HeFEp5dv7Q.text: My experience at Umami. Well there was so many things that went wrong. The biggest issues were not getting the food we ordered and had to ask over 4 times where the food was. The waiter even though he was kind couldn't remember he had already asked me many times if I needed anything else after delivering our new orders that our original orders never showed up. We were there for over and hr and our food and appetizers didn't come till the end. They also gave our waters to the table next to us. The table next to us got someone else's food. Idk if it was a fluke of the evening or what but with a son who's special needs who gets hangry this wasn't the place or experience for us. They offered us desserts but after not getting my sons food or drinks till the end of our meal I didn't want to chance waiting any longer. We had stayed way longer than what we wanted but only because they couldn't deliver the food. By the time they got around to delivering it the meats were burnt and the soy beans weren't even the correct ones. The staff is friendly and the place is clean but that's all I can say about that. Also I was told I was given drinks for free for the inconvenience but was still charged for a drink. I know it's petty but after waiting forever for food and then being told no charge for drinks only for that to be wrong as well is too much for me and won't return or recommend. Two stars because they were friendly and clean.

fXLXQVCS6y_NV7yDdYoUtA.text: Umami is absolutely outstanding. The nigiri is by far the best option but all the rolls I had were outstanding (besides "I love lobster"). My wife and I tried a wide variety of the food and all of it was high quality and delicious. The servers and staff were very attentive to us. Umami is definitely our new local sushi spot.

WiF1284B3dGyS-rEu5I48g.text: To Umami owner, thank you so much for your response.  One of the things that disappointed me was when I asked for salmon skin temaki I was given a cut roll and was told that is how temaki is made.  Since I have been eating sushi for about 30 years, I know that temaki is a hand roll.  I usually ask for Saba shiso temaki but I didn't in this instance.  And I also got unagi sushi with some kind of sweet sauce on it, another first for me, and I didn't particularly enjoy it with the sauce.  My friend who has little experience with sushi was satisfied with her food, which is why I said it was geared to American tastes, which is not necessarily a bad thing.  I just prefer a more traditional Japanese sushi.

k5RV61dhxT95PbGHowIlxA.text: I'm not really at this part of town but was craving for some sushi and found this little hidden gem! Went in and was immediately greeted by the host with a welcoming "Iirashaimase" which means welcome in Japanese. Our server was Marcelo and he grabbed all our orders promptly. When the sushi came out, I was really surprised because the rice and fish ratio was surprisingly good! Lots of fish and little rice? Thank you! All the Nigiris were fantastic but I would really recommend the Smoked Paprika Salmon nigiri! This nigiri is super flavorful! And of course Marcelo came back and always checked on our group, which is a huge plus to me because I understand AYCE sushi joints can get a bit busy. I really enjoyed their dessert selection also. My group ordered the Mini Honey Toast but I got the Tempura Ice Cream. Both desserts were amazing! This place is a must!

zBok5LjCoX4ek95T8ORXhg.text: Came here on a weekday afternoon with my friends this past week. The atmosphere is clean and welcoming. I tried a few of their sushi rolls : Big Bang and the Wet dream., both were up to par with most other sushi restaurants. I also had the tempura udon, which was pretty good as well. The customer service was quick and efficient. Overall the place was pretty good and the price was decent enough to where I'll be back again

9wrzfl3a76BwoOTdB3r4tA.text: Really cool place great food and great location in Centennial the staff is amazing and the place is pretty romantic lights damn perfect for date night

6_Zj3D04_H9e2BA8zdou2A.text: So apparently I've been here once a few years ago, but I don't remember.. so let's all agree this is my first time? Cool. Alright, moving on. Sushi on the northwest part of town is decent and found myself in the mood for something close by. The decor and set up gives the restaurant a chill and open vibe with flowers and homey touches; perfect for the weather warming up!  Our server was hilarious and honestly made the whole experience much more than I anticipated. His name was Marcello (my bad on spelling) and he was attentive, made good recommendations (yes get the KFC and salmon nigiri.. just do it), and he had such a laid back personality. We're all probably here for the food, so let's get to it.  I love the AYCE option and they offer half rolls on most rolls. Definitely get anything with the s.o. sauce (yep just get it). Some standouts for me was the tuna and salmon; so delicious with thick slices, and I loved the Chanel roll.. Sweet yet spicy, and just plain ol' delicious.   If you find yourself on this side of town, roll in for lunch or dinner. High five if you caught the sushi roll reference.

3h-HPFhl4q23_b7zvW-D0w.text: Best value and great food. The all you can eat option is a great way to try new food. Food presentation and taste was very good. Service personnel were friendly and welcoming. We will be back for more.

JeAqSL5L-F7OIrjoHGfQVA.text: Ate AYCE lunch there today 08/11 our first time there and was very impressed! Fish was fresh, everything was really good, We had Ceasar as our server, he actually sits next to customers and takes orders sometimes providing a personal touch and is very attentive, excellent service, we were never rushed through our ordering like some other places  their Nigiri is incredible, everything from service to food was beyond our expectations! Will definitely return!

NZNXkPsG6OM_gL4ZhcL91g.text: Third or 4th time here and it was awesome! Only thing I ordered I didn't care for was the bacon wrapped scallops as they tasted a little fishy. Everything else I ordered was great: mini udon, shrimp tempura, bacon wrapped lobster, sirada lobster nigiri, shrimp nigiri, deep fried lobster special roll, popcorn lobster roll, bulgogi, and deep fried banana with vanilla ice cream. Of course it helps and makes a huge difference to have awesome service from David, Marcello, and one of the coolest owners, Jitto. Highly recommend it!

pjaoQoPFMEs4Qof2NbQW7g.text: How many times can you change your menu? This place knows. They won't tell me though.   From good to all the shit you can eat. The food was not good. It was covered in really sweet yum sauce.   And really? Some of the worst service we've ever had in Las Vegas. Our waitress never checked up on us. She kept walking by with nothing. Never gave us water and gave us one glass for our two beers. She said they ran out. We had to ask her 30 minutes later to bring one. After an hour of not being served, we saw her walk out with her purse. Nice.   Other guys kind of checked up on us. Still took forever to get anything. Had to ask for the check twice.  Yes, it was busy. To busy for them not to be able to serve? No. I watched everyone else that came in the time we did leave 20-30 mins before us.  The most ridiculous part was listening to the waiters constantly get onto the sushi chefs. Eye rolling, yelling, rudeness. It was quite uncomfortable.   Man, sucks. This place was good. Now, it sucks butt.

bbD9U9LrRX_MpjEY9lywlA.text: Maybe we just went on a bad night but I don't understand the hype...our Party of 2 was seated the same time as a party of 8. We ordered before the other party however they got their drinks and food about 10 minutes before we did. We even got warm water...like really? Our rolls were not good and very fishy, and the next day we are paying for that. We had to remind the host about our water and food we never got. I will not be going again. The cheap rolls reflect the fishy taste and lack of service.

jQFMLvH307-dGuat4Pc0Rg.text: This is one of our go-to spots for AYCE sushi! It's at a good location (off of 215 & N. Durango), their fish is definitely fresh, they have a wide variety on their menu, & the price is just right. Their dining area is a good size, clean atmosphere, and (of course) a sushi bar if you prefer that dining experience. If you've been to Sakana or Sushi Neko, you'd notice that their menus are very similar to each other. I believe they're owned by the same owner/family? Please correct me if I'm wrong.   Like I said, they have a lot of items on their menu! Last time we visited here, we ordered edamame, The Shit, Power Up, Baked Green Mussels, Hamachi Kama, Nigiri (salmon, tuna, garlic tuna, yuzu yellowtail [my fave nigiri], super white tuna, and mackerel), all of the bacon & _____ skewers, & their sushi rolls (Lobster Special, Wet Dream, Lasagna, Baked Lobster, Lemon Salmon, Captain America, & Wonder Woman). My person favorites are the Lemon Salmon rolls (because I love the combination of lemon + salmon), Hamachi Kama, & their nigiris. They have an amazing fish-to-rice ratio, but sometimes it tends to fall apart so I end up eating with my hands instead. Traditionally, that's how it should be anyway.   As far as service goes, they're pretty great when it comes to ordering your food, getting the dirty plates off of your table, and refilling your water. Out of the x amount of times I've been here, I've only had one day where I had bad service. Lately, it's been great!   Big heads up: I don't know if it's just me, but their tables feel sticky sometimes. It's not too big of deal, but it could be an issue to some.  TLDR; Bomb sushi place up in Centennial Hills with great service, great fish-to-rice ratio on nigiri, & similar to Sushi Neko + Sakana.

jRdGldCOtl2yil5iDn_JYw.text: I've enjoyed meals at Umami's sister restaurant, Sushi Neko, but was super excited to find this restaurant because it's way closer to my house. And oh man, I might not ever need to go back to Sushi Neko. The food selection at Umami is similar, the restaurant appears to be newer and cleaner and the food quality is on point, but it was the service that really set Umami apart. I'll be back!

PSexGILIetHMC4jL3BSv2Q.text: The sushi is great, they have an amazing selection. Now the customers service is something else, they are the best! They are all very attentive, they bring out your items right away... the only thing I probably didn't like was the sauce that's put on top of the rolls, it was cold. Other than that it was great,  I will be back!

UmKh14gSfaIJWVS3xhA_OQ.text: Being from Hawai'i, I did not imagine finding a sushi restaurant out in Las Vegas that was as good as I'd get from home. But Umami proved me wrong, and it was AYCE for a reasonable price. The sushi was high quality and super fresh! The uni was especially amazing. It's a bit of a drive if you're staying on the strip but definitely worth it. Will try to go back whenever I go back to Vegas!

aWYIyCucNnK5qcNMkxsdrg.text: This was mine and my wife first time coming to this sushi bar, first thing I can say is it was clean, staff was amazing and super nice. As for the sushi it was amazing, the amount of fish to rice was amazing. My wife especially enjoyed the nigiri, all I can say is when we come back to Vegas we will definitely be coming back!

6c_LoeTJy4gR1RTYc9SseA.text: This has & I hope to continue having this be my go to place at least 2-3 times a month. However, I do like how they have redone the place, but am very disappointed that they no longer have seats at the sushi bar. The reason I go to a sushi bar is to sit at the sushi bar & be up close with my sushi chefs & watch what they do & serve me. I really hope that they bring back seats at the sushi bar for those that really like the experience of sitting at the SUSHI BAR!!  Please Bring Seats Back Soon!!!  Thank you from a loyal   I went back again last Thursday & was still not happy to see that the chairs were still not at the sushi bar. Also, every since I have had to sit at the tables the quality seems to have gone down. I'm also wondering why both TV's are playing these strange Japanese type videos. Either have a sports game on in the background or maybe play American music that we can understand.  Think it's time to find another place with my friends since things have changed so much.  I will need to see if the chairs come back at the sushi bar, quality gets better & music changes.

y2Xu1hvYyaqPJ_tXowiAjA.text: Sushi is not bad, but this is one of those AYCE places that loads you up with softballs of rice to fill you up. A Maki Nigiri piece will be a mouthful so prepare yourself of some serious chew and fat cheeks. If you order a roll then your meal is done. You're full! Also, All other AYCE on oysters at least gives you 2 pcs limited to one order. Here, one. Not worth the premium $26.95 + tax-tip for a rice dinner. There's far better places to go in Vegas. Tried it twice. Not going for a 3rd. Absolutely hate it when places do this with the rice. C'mon guys!  I'm one of those folks that love and know sushi. Good and bad. Y4ojM9sE2F4x-2oI9vj_DA.text: So Im not entirely new to sushi by any means and hadnt tried a place out here in vegas since I moved. I saw some reviews on this location and figured I would give it a try.   First off, the music is supppper loud. Communicating is difficult without trying to talk over the music. At some point the quality went down and it was just an unpleasant older radio sound but far too loud for my comfort..however, maybe thats just me.   As for the food, I highly advise sticking mostly with their nigiri.  The fish to rice ratio is actually awesome and reasonable. But once you start getting to the rolls...holy moly..talk about a mayonnaise overload. Everything is so drenched in mayo that deciphering tastes is near impossible. And you wouldn't even know they were going to have mayo on them by the menu, because nothing says that. It was an unpleasant surprise to say the least. The salmon skin handroll was chewy and not quite what I expect but still ok nonetheless.   All in all, I probably wont be coming back. I cant handle the intense mayo tastes, strict time limits, and lack of kids options.

WsoDu2CAosD42D1MyUoHWQ.text: Update November 25, 2017. Umami has new ownership and had turned into the typical AYCE sushi place. I've been and was unimpressed with the new service or quality of food. Stay away.  If you're honest with yourself you know there hasn't been any really good sushi in Centennial. When I need sushi I've been willing to drive 20 minutes away for a decent restaurant.   I think Umami may have changed that. My husband and I went recently on a weekday night and sat at the sushi bar. Freshness and flavor were comparable to the better places in Chinatown or on the strip. They had special selections of fish that were not on the menu but offered to us. And this is really important - the sushi chefs were very knowledgeable about different types of fish and flavor. We really like this place and will return!  Things I'd like to see- wi-Fi. If you had Wi-Fi I'd probably eat there every day. I can't come for lunch and be completely detached from work. I'd also like to see options like chirashi or donburi. Not sure if I'm able to order this off the menu--if available, please let me know!

ASsoPllqWFJp1ULh8MIBAw.text: I am so happy to of found this place!!! I love Sakana but it's such a far drive from my house I hardly ever make it there. Dz35RCCZGVrRdIsT7smrOQ.text: This place is amazing. Very clean and the sushi is awesome. My boyfriend and I wanted to try another AYCE sushi place. Not a lot of choices in centennial or North Las Vegas area. Saw the reviews on Umami and we were not disappointed.

Omh0ei9WnyfblH5ONs0vhg.text: I can't say enough good things about this place. My boyfriend and I were craving AYCE sushi & we decided to try Umami. We were immediately assured the food would be amazing when we noticed Umami is owned by the same owners are Hwaro, the AYCE cajun spot, Sakana & Sushi Neko.   It's $21.95 for lunch & $26.95 for dinner & worth every penny! Our server was kind enough to tell us for the rolls you can order **half rolls** so we were able to try more. She also checked up on us often to ask if we wanted to order more. All the food that came out was delicious and one of the better sushi restaurants i've tried. Try "the shit," "pang" and the monkey brain roll!  For dessert, we had an affogato, mini honey toast + red bean & green tea ice cream!  Will definitely be back!

t8P-7k3MeasUipQHXaJ1LA.text: There are few Japanese restaurants that offer both sushi and ramen, so I was hoping Umami would fit the bill. Unfortunately, the ramen pales in comparison to the rich broth and melt-in-your-mouth pork that you will find in locales that specialize in ramen. Don't order the ramen here.  The teriyaki beef was rather tough and overly smothered with sauce. Also disappointing.   Might be worth another visit to try the AYCE sushi, whose menu is enormous.

lOtnsC3qkIioewvffGWO5w.text: I went in for the ayce dinner, seeing that the reviews have been better. I was blown away by the food quality and taste! I order a bunch of half rolls and all if them were so good! I cant wait to come back!

rWGZBLCJFXYhXPsr7Xkgug.text: This is by far my FAVORITE sushi place. I believe the 'all you can eat' is a great deal for everything you can get. You don't just have the option to order sushi with the ayce, you can also order salads, soups, etc. The servings are also very generous. The Sashimi fish is often cut thick. The rolls are cut large. The customer service is good for the most part. I totally recommend the Salmon Belly Sashimi, Hamachi Kama, and the Ami Ebi.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is the Ami Ebi.

A3_0gBlnaIJsu9JLEZumWw.text: Warning: new owners, new menu. Don't come here if you are looking to experience the original ala carte menu.  Uuuuughhhhh wish I wasn't writing this review. I used to come here often when it was owned by the original owners and this place was amazing. They had an ala carte menu but honestly it was worth paying the price because the quality/presentation was soooo worth it.  Now that Umami has been bought out by the owners of Sakana (boooooo) they have completely changed the menu and are now an all you can eat sushi joint. So if you are looking for quality look else where, this place is all about quantity now.  First off, I haven't been a fan of Sakana. I hate the way they portion their nigiri with 90% fish and 10% rice. I was almost positive it was going to be the same at this newly managed Umami so I started off with a small order.   -beef bowl -chicken bowl -seared salmon with lemon nigiri -Japanese lasagna roll -#1 roll chef makes  Umami originally had a beef bowl (gyuudon) so we were under the impression it was going to be the same delicious bowl, but when it came out we got a teriyaki beef bowl. The meat was SO chewy my mouth was getting tired after eating one piece. We ended up asking the server if we could switch it out for a chicken bowl because it was so hard to eat. They accommodated us and got rid of the beef bowl. The taste of the seared salmon with lemon was good, but I was right about the portions and couldn't eat the whole piece of nigiri. The lasagna roll was decent and so was the #1. Nothing special.   The server we had was good and he was definitely handling a lot of tables as best as he could. When I got my bill he had still charged us for the beef bowl instead of the chicken, but he was so busy I didn't care to get it taken care of. It was a $1 difference. They gave me a 10% discount for showing my military ID.  I was definitely upset the whole dinner because I wasn't expecting the food to be that bad... but it was lol. I won't be coming back since I am not a fan of Sakana or Sushi Neko.

SVkPSvB4eEXWCNI2W1aL3w.text: The food was great! We did have a large party and they did forget my egg rolls but I would definitely give them another try!

VcnFB_-UYKaHsF_1Sceu6Q.text: This was my second time dining here. Clean and spacious. Ayce is good. Some Limitations between lunch and dinner.overall food quality is good service was fast and friendly. Music was just a tad loud.

mdBJ39y0CuDEFWTu711hNw.text: I've been waiting for a place like this to open up in the North West.  I've been to the local sushi spots around this area and have been disappointed many times.  However, Umami fits the bill in so many ways that I have to give it 5 stars.  I only hope that the quality stays high.  We are regulars and we have tried so many things already on the menu.  The things my wife and I love:  - Sushi & Sashimi Platter - Beautiful design, high quality fish, assortment of pickled sides. - Shoyu Raman - Pork broth is slow cooked all day and isn't super cloudy. - Short Ribs - Flavorful but not just slathered with sauce.  Beautiful marinade. - Taco Wasabi - Raw Octopus with Wasabi sauce, its an acquired taste but they do it well! - Tempura - Nice and Crispy! - Number 5 Roll - Albacore Tuna, Spicy Tuna, and the best part fried onion rings! - Strawberry Champagne Cake - Delicate and savory - Tempura Ice Cream - Duh, it's just awesome!  The service is top notch.  They've only been open for 2 weeks and I've already spoken to Chef Jun and the Restaurant Manager several times.  They care about what you think and communicate with you because they want to know what they did well and how they can improve.  The wait staff is friendly but you can tell this is a little new to all of them.  Nevertheless, I always felt attended to.  The establishment is a reflection of a more high-end sushi bar that might be near the strip.  On the far wall from the entrance is a huge painted mural of samurai.  If you're a sports fan they also have large screens playing all the games.  One of my favorite parts this the music they play.  They have a mix of downtempo and upbeat instrumental hip hop.    If you are in the area or live near I definitely recommend coming here.  I'm so happy to have a Japanese restaurant that has both sushi and ramen.

K82RNImB_NX2dC4QWOHbcw.text: Finally, a great all you can sushi bar in Centennial Hills.  No more driving to China Town.

bZNZJVip23Su2e9LHvxHog.text: I had initially gone when this place was a Ramen Noodle Restaurant, i went as a date night with my husband and we really liked the service, and their restaurant was so nice & cozy. We thought we found out "Ramen Noodle" favorite spot and little to our imagination... we ended up going back a month later & the place was completely renovated and they didn't have their Ramen Noodle menu anymore. It's now an AYCE sushi restaurant. The sushi was pretty good, although the wait we had was an 1.20 hours!! So many people were going ahead of us because we had a party of 5 adults +2 toddlers. The guy kept updating us with a 20 min wait and it was 5x that!! He did offer us drinks on the restaurant which was nice, I just didn't like that we had to wait so long when they could've combined 2 other tables and gave us a high chair for our 2 toddlers.

lQPVhHGtQb7oE1-Qa0eSkg.text: Although they have a new menu, the sushi is fresh and beautifully presented. We sat at the sushi bar and it was great to see all the options going out to other tables.  Finding out they now offer "all you can eat" was just an added bonus.  I really loved how the tools were not drowning in sauce.  We will be back.

1DcVUBfAHkm2yNCrr1rRJQ.text: We had been loyal patrons of this restaurant until recently.  They've changed management and now are just like every other bland "all you can eat" place.  One of the things that we loved about the prior menu was that they used quality ingredients, offered high end sashimi and other non-roll type food.  For this reason, we were there at least once a week and spent well over $100 each visit.  Tonight we sadly left and won't be back.  In addition to their new menu problems, any business that decides it's ok to fire all of their chefs and waitstaff with NO NOTICE is not one that I want to spend my money at.  The only thing better than their food was their previous staff.  We truly enjoyed that we could walk in, be seated, and the wait staff knew what we wanted to drink and the chefs knew what appetizers we wanted to start with.  Firing all of these talented people was a huge business blunder.  Sorry Umami, you've lost extremely loyal customers who are very vocal.  Instead of sending new people your way, we are informing all of our friends about everything we saw and warning them about all the steps down in quality.

T0hJ68uEDpnn3lYwAQdVZg.text: Under new mgmt. New menu and now all you can eat.  New staff and chefs were friendly and helpful, but the high end sushi options and the presentation are gone. Plastic menus and paper napkins.      The salmon, tuna and shrimp sushi I tried were OK, but my etemami did not seem fresh. It is not bad as all you can eat places go. If that is what you want. I am looking for higher end up here in the NW area. I liked not having to go all the way down to the strip. Miss the old sushi chefs and my fav sushi dishes. SO BUMMED!

GaY-cCi-iNLH_ZjBil_iKw.text: Walking in this place feels like it should be on the strip , thankfully it's not. I love the upscale feel with out having to deal with the tourist and going downtown. We were seated almost immediately and the waitress went over the drinks and made some recommendations. The menu is simple and not overwhelming. They have your topical rolls and Nigiri with a nice number of restaurant specific rolls.   We went with a nice mix of rolls and nigiri. The food came out in a timely manner spread out few rolls at a time. ( I have been to some restaurants where they dump your whole order at once and it's overwhelming).  The presentation of the food was nice . The food was delicious , everything was fresh and great portions of fish , no ingredient was overwhelming.  I highly recommend the Vegas roll and the Sammon nigiri.   The cost for a NOT ALL YOU CAN EAT restaurant was fair , not to expensive and good value. I think our bill for 2 people with beer and about 4 rolls and 2 nigiri was around $65.   My 2 down sides ( still not worth dropping to a 4 star, they bugged me but the wife thought I was being crazy ). The front door has a bell on it when it opens , it drove me crazy lol.  Second,  soda you get a can , I just hate it it's $2 for a soda and you bring me a can ,  makes me feel like wtf I just paid $2 for a can ahahaha. ( the food still over powers this complaint )

photos.caption: Photo of Umami - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot date with the wife!

6aGB1cLWqab9R0UI6iSO1w.text: Under new management. Came here 3 weeks ago and had the best sushi like we normally do. About three days ago I was craving sushi so decided to stop by and was surprised by the new management sign outside. Still decided to go in hoping the menu, quality  and attention to detail was still the same. But nope the menu is completely different and worst of all they converted the restaurant to an all you can eat place. After glancing at the menu for about 15 minutes because nothing stood out and also service was terrible. We just decided to walk out and eat elsewhere.  Extremely disappointed that I lost my favorite local sushi place. PS also all my pictures from this place are from the previous management.

2-f2f6FD4f74whKFpMEluw.text: I've been here a few times so far and Mark has always been my server! He's very accommodating!!! Great selection and outstanding flavors! I suggest trying the mussels they're my favorite!

vgk_1cj95bWGu-3Iik1Tpg.text: Don't bother going here. There's new owners, the food is gross, the place is empty, and it's expensive compared to other delicious AYCE Sushi restaurants in town. The pictures that are being used are from the previous owners. You'll go there and order something you've seen on here and you get something completely different and tasteless.   Save your time and money- go elsewhere.

f0LIZDC-IK6Ek9R0bIJQdA.text: We thought we'd give Umami a try after seeing the reviews here and this place is great! Fish is high quality and portions very generous! I've recommended to some friends since and they've agreed. We will definitely be back!  Be sure to try 'The Shit' and 'Pang' from the appetizer list; first time I've had anything like that. The salmonholic roll was a hit as well!

jMhR09xBp02PYA3WFh-U9Q.text: Love this place. Sushi is good and consistent and it's just like Sushi Neko on Spring Mountain; so happy they put one over here!

xmU1N3pkcfxarilddzg0IA.text: Oh man, no more lobster ramen. There is no more ramen at all.  They've switched their menu to be an all you can eat place now. Everyone is asking about the ramen and I did as well today. They're just switching things up. I'm just a little sad about it.  Oh well.

iwkfjucf9Qd-qHXkUiPM6g.text: I had to give this place three stars because I wasn't as impressed as some of the other reviewers. The sushi was pretty good but the execution lacked creativity. All three of the rolls we ordered were placed on a plate with a dollop of sauce - nothing fancy to see here folks.   I agree with one review here about the fish being cut too thick. The fish should be cut delicately thin, if you want to be authentic.   The ambience could be so much better without the tvs. If I want to catch the game I can walk down to Buffalo Wild Wings! They're so out of place!!! Get rid of the tvs, paint some Japanese anime in their place and you have appropriate ambience.   Finally, the service was slow even though the place was almost empty when we came here. We had to ask for ginger and wasabi, too.

photos.caption: Photo of Umami - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of the rolls we ordered. Tasted pretty good but not artistic at all. Sushi is an art!

5alKeWh8smlHARIX9ODISw.text: The wife and I stopped in around 2p.m. On a Monday for late lunch/early dinner.  Only one other set of customers in business.  This was our first visit here.  We were greeted promptly by one of the waitstaff.  We opted to sit at the sushi bar.  We ordered tako wasabi and screaming O appetizers.  The tako wasabi was a very good sized portion of blissful fresh octopus marinated in wasabi and a little chilli.  Very tasty.  The screaming O didn't get made until we had a couple other rolls.  While the tuna was fresh and tasty, the sauce was like watery soup.    We also had a Carson roll, a No Name roll, Number 5 roll and a Red Bull.  All the rolls were very nicely made and generally very tasty except for the No Name Roll.  That particular roll was so mild tasting I really did not know what I was eating.  Also the No Name is made like Futumaki, five large pieces.  Service was top notch.  Everyone checked on us numerous times and the chef was friendly and fast.  Would definitely go back.  We decided next time to try the ramen.

XF-cQ4OGovi4qbyffp7vcw.text: I definitely recommend this sushi restaurant if you have not been here yet. The atmosphere is relaxing, the staff is friendly, the service is fast and most of all the food is delicious. One of my favorite rolls is the Hawaiian roll.

Jb6Guj5PjjIgW_guvZykRw.text: Been here once. I sat at the bar. The food was good. Its seating arrangement is odd in relation to the building structure. Overall its good.

125_QWpOUYFiyVSqmh3Qjw.text: Good sushi, haven't tried the AYCE but I hear good things. We went with family while they were in town and didn't want to go too far with kids. In North Las Vegas this is a good sushi spot. They weren't very busy which was nice. They took our order quickly and service was great.
